0.title: RR end LSG's 3-match winning streak, jump to top of IPL 2022 points table
0.article_body: RR fast bowler Kuldeep Sen, playing in his first-ever IPL match, defended 15 runs in the last over to help his team defeat LSG by three runs. With this, RR ended LSG's three-match winning streak. RR have now jumped to the top of the IPL 2022 points table with three victories and a superior net run-rate of +0.951.

1.title: 14 unicorns created, $10.8 bn invested in startups in Q4 FY22: Report
1.article_body: As many as 14 startups attained the unicorn status in India in Q4 FY22 with the startup ecosystem attracting investment of $10.8 billion, a report by accounting firm PwC India said. With 334 funding deals in the quarter, India now has a total of 84 unicorns. With five unicorns, the software-as-a-service (SaaS) sector accounted for the largest sector-wise share.

2.title: Mexicans vote in first-ever referendum against President
2.article_body: Mexicans on Sunday began voting in a referendum on whether President Andrés Manuel López Obrador should end his term barely midway through or continue to the end. Obrador had himself pushed for the first so-called recall referendum in modern Mexico. Critics have claimed the referendum is a waste of money, which will cost the public exchequer almost $80 million.

3.title: Students clash in JNU over non-veg food, Ram Navami pooja; some injured
3.article_body: Some students in Delhi's JNU sustained injuries following a clash between members of ABVP and the Left-wing over the consumption of non-vegetarian food and the conduct of Ram Navami pooja. ABVP allegedly tried to stop non-veg from being cooked in Kaveri hostel mess. As per ABVP, however, Left-wing students tried to disrupt Ram Navami pooja. Police have been called in.

4.title: I am serious: Musk on poll to turn Twitter headquarters into homeless shelter
4.article_body: Elon Musk, the world's richest person and Twitter's biggest shareholder, tweeted, "I'm serious about this", about a poll to turn Twitter headquarters in San Francisco into a homeless shelter. At the time of writing, over 91% of the respondents had voted in favour of turning the Twitter headquarters into a homeless shelter. Musk was recently named to Twitter's board.

5.title: 1,222 bodies found in Kyiv region so far: Ukrainian official
5.article_body: Ukraine's Prosecutor General Iryna Venediktova on Sunday said that 1,222 bodies have been found in the region around Kyiv so far. The areas around Ukraine's capital were recently retaken by Ukrainian forces during a retreat by Russian forces in northern Ukraine. The Ukrainian government has accused the Russian forces of committing atrocities against the civilians during their occupation.

6.title: Private taxidermy museum with over 1,000 stuffed animals found in Spain
6.article_body: Spain is investigating a businessman who owned a private taxidermy collection with more than 1,000 stuffed animals. The collection includes over 400 specimens from protected species and at least one specimen of a North African oryx, already extinct. Stuffed animals were found in two warehouses extending over 50,000 square metres on the outskirts of Spain's Bétera.

7.title: Planning permanent military presence on our eastern borders: NATO chief
7.article_body: NATO is working to set up a permanent military presence along its eastern borders in a bid to counter any future Russian threat, Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said. He added that the bloc is "in the midst of a very fundamental transformation", which will reflect "long-term consequences" of Putin's actions. Stoltenberg's tenure as NATO chief has been extended till September 2023.

8.title: Capitan, you've done it again: Rana on RRR crossing ₹1,000 cr globally
8.article_body: Actor Rana Daggubati, taking to Twitter, congratulated filmmaker SS Rajamouli after his film 'RRR' crossed ₹1,000 crores globally after 16 days of its release. "'ONE INDIA ONE CINEMA' was...wishful dream till one man came along and said this is what it looks like!! Capitan, you've done it again," he tweeted. Rana and Rajamouli have worked together in the 'Baahubali' franchise.

9.title: BJP doesn't have patent for Hindutva: Uddhav Thackeray
9.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday said BJP doesn't hold the "patent for Hindutva" and that Shiv Sena has always been committed to bhagva (saffron) and Hindutva. "I wonder had Lord Ram not been born, what issue the BJP would have raised in politics. Since BJP is bereft of issues, it is talking about religion and [spreading] hatred," Thackeray said.

10.title: I had no idea, I just turned and saw him go off: Hetmyer on Ashwin retiring out
10.article_body: Talking about Ravichandran Ashwin retiring out in 19th over against LSG, RR's Shimron Hetmyer, who was the other batter on the pitch at the time, said, "I literally had no idea about it." He added, "I just turned and saw him go off. He was a...bit tired. It was a good decision as Riyan Parag hit a six," Hetmyer said.

11.title: Clashes break out during Ram Navami processions in 2 Gujarat cities
11.article_body: Clashes were reported during Ram Navami processions in Himmatnagar and Khambhat in Gujarat on Sunday. Two groups pelted stones at each other, damaged shops and vehicles, following which the police fired tear gas shells to control the situation. The number of injuries recorded in both incidents is not known yet, officials said.

12.title: Would be intimidated if I'm offered film with Hrithik Roshan: Shahid
12.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said he would be intimidated if he is offered a film with actor Hrithik Roshan. "Because I...love Hrithik as an action hero and I really love him as a dancer so I would...be very nervous," Shahid stated. "I would tell him to do a bit of 'Haider' type role? Because that is my comfort zone," he added.

13.title: Was bathroom singer, thought why not take it seriously: Tiger Shroff
13.article_body: Tiger Shroff said he was a bathroom singer and added he sang well. "I thought why not take it seriously...I just wanted to start it as a hobby," he stated. "One of my goals in life was to perform on stage and sing...dance to my...songs," he added. Tiger made his singing debut in Bollywood with 'Heropanti 2' song 'Miss Hairan'.

14.title: Sri Lankan economic crisis may cause more deaths than COVID: Doctors
14.article_body: The economic crisis in Sri Lanka may lead to more deaths than those caused by COVID-19, according to Sri Lanka Medical Association (SLMA). All hospitals in the country no longer had access to imported medical tools and vital drugs, it claimed. "We're made to make very difficult choices. We've to decide who gets treatment and who will not," it said.

15.title: I bowl googlies more than leg-break as it turns more: RCB's Hasaranga
15.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore spinner Wanindu Hasaranga has said that he bowls googlies more than leg-spin deliveries because his googly "turns more than" his leg-break delivery. Speaking about his team's seven-wicket win over Mumbai Indians on Saturday, Hasaranga said, "Definitely happy with my performance, but happier with the team's win." Hasaranga scalped two wickets in the IPL 2022 match.

16.title: Video of Pak PM candidate knocking off mics during speeches goes viral
16.article_body: A video of Pakistan PM candidate Shehbaz Sharif knocking off microphones while delivering speeches has gone viral online. The video shows Sharif hitting mics with his hand gestures on several occasions while speaking at public events in Pakistan. "India mustn't take Shehbaz Sharif lightly. He's literally a mover and shaker," said one Twitter user on the video.

17.title: Don't know why I didn't get much work when I was younger: Ratna
17.article_body: Veteran actress Ratna Pathak Shah has stated that she doesn't know why she didn't get much work when she was younger, adding there was something about her that wasn't acceptable. "I was just not looked at, maybe because I was (Naseeruddin Shah's) wife and they thought I was just not interested in working. Thankfully that's done and dusted," Ratna added.

18.title: Carter and I would love to have twins: Paris Hilton
18.article_body: American socialite and businesswoman Paris Hilton has said that she would "love" to have twins with her husband Carter Reum. "I would like a twin boy and girl just to, like, get both...I would love that or twin girls because I love girls," she told the People magazine. Paris and Carter tied the knot in November last year.

19.title: Tunisians rally against Prez Saied, accuse him of 'failed dictatorship'
19.article_body: Thousands of Tunisians took to the streets in capital Tunis to protest against President Kais Saied, accusing him of imposing one-man rule in Tunisia after he dissolved parliament last month. "We are facing a failed dictatorship...We will continue to protest...until...coup is forced to reverse its decisions," a protester said. Saied also dissolved Tunisia's Supreme Judicial Council in February.

20.title: BJP gave freedom to UP's private schools to raise fees: Sisodia
20.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Sunday said BJP-led Uttar Pradesh government has given the state's private schools the freedom to increase their fees. "Within 10 days of government formation...[Punjab] CM Bhagwant Mann issued an order saying private schools cannot increase their fees," Sisodia said. Delhi's private schools have been stopped from arbitrarily increasing fees since 2015, he added.

21.title: UP vegetable sellers' daughter Mumtaz stars in junior women's hockey World Cup
21.article_body: Mumtaz Khan, the 19-year-old daughter of vegetable sellers Qaiser Jahan and Hafiz Khan from Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow, helped India beat S Korea in the junior women's hockey World Cup quarterfinal on Friday. "I would've loved to watch her score the goal, but I've got to earn a living as well," her mother, who was selling vegetables during Mumtaz's match, said.

22.title: Ravichandran Ashwin becomes first cricketer to be retired out in IPL history
22.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has become the first cricketer to be retired out in IPL history. Ashwin left the field in the 19th over of RR's innings against LSG after scoring 28(23). A batter is considered retired out if he retires his innings without the umpire's permission and cannot resume the innings.

23.title: Andhra CM inducts 14 new ministers into Cabinet in massive reshuffle
23.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy has reconstituted his Cabinet and inducted 14 new ministers. He has retained 11 ministers, including Deputy CM K Narayanaswamy, Women and Child Welfare Minister Taneti Vanita and Social Welfare Minister Pinipe Viswarupu. The revamped Cabinet will see 68% representation from Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes and Backward Classes.

24.title: Worry about your own kids: Khloé to trolls saying she holds daughter too much
24.article_body: Television personality Khloé Kardashian took to Twitter to react to trolls saying that she holds her daughter 'too much' after she carried her during the Los Angeles premiere of 'The Kardashians'. "I'm gonna hold my baby until I can't hold her anymore...When there's tons of cameras around...I want my baby to feel safe. Worry about your own children," she wrote.

25.title: You’ll get Twitter verification back, even if you shorted Tesla: Musk to investor
25.article_body: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded after American investor Michael Burry, who was portrayed in the movie 'The Big Short', said he was no longer a verified user on Twitter. "You will get it back, even though you shorted Tesla," Musk, the largest shareholder of Twitter, said. Burry ditched his bearish bets against Musk-led Tesla last year.

26.title: Russian rocket attack completely destroyed Dnipro airport: Ukraine
26.article_body: Russian forces fired rockets into Ukraine's Dnipro on Sunday, completely destroying an airport in the city, a local official said. Attacks on the city, which lies on the banks of Dnieper River, intensified on Sunday, the official added. Five staffers of the state emergency service were wounded by the strike on the airport, the head of Dnipro region council said.

27.title: Cong neither Indian nor national, only brother-sister party: Nadda
27.article_body: While addressing a gathering in Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur, BJP president Jagat Prakash Nadda on Sunday said that Congress is neither Indian nor national, but only a brother-sister party. He further said, "Apart from BJP, there is no political party in the country that runs without promoting familism, many opposition parties have become regional parties only."

28.title: Important to have a second income to be choosy: Angad Hasija
28.article_body: Television actor Angad Hasija has stated that it is important to have a second income if one wants to be choosy with roles, else they would have to do whatever is offered. He is also a qualified architect and interior designer. "[My mom] wanted me to be an actor and that is how I came in this field," Angad added.

29.title: Sitaram Yechury re-elected as CPI(M) General Secretary for 3rd term
29.article_body: Sitaram Yechury was re-elected as General Secretary of CPI(M) for a third consecutive term at party's 23rd congress meet in Kerala's Kannur on Sunday. A 17-member politburo and 85-member central committee was also inducted at meet. Yechury, who was first elected to the post in 2015, had succeeded senior party leader Prakash Karat, who held the post for 10 years.

30.title: COVID-19 vaccines working against all variants: WHO chief scientist
30.article_body: COVID-19 vaccines are working against all variants of the SARS-CoV-2 virus at this point in time in preventing severe disease and death, said World Health Organisation (WHO) chief scientist Dr Soumya Swaminathan. "In the future, if we need to, we may have to change the composition of vaccines and we need to be prepared for that," she further said.

31.title: He's an idealist: Simi Garewal shares 2 learnings from Imran Khan's exit as Pak PM
31.article_body: Former actor and TV show host Simi Garewal on Sunday tweeted about what Imran Khan's exit as Pakistan PM taught her, saying, "1. A joint opposition can dismiss a popular Prime Minister. 2 Politics is no place for idealists." She added, "I've known Imran for 40 years and idealism is at his core."

32.title: Virat Kohli meets Baby AB after getting out to him, MI share video
32.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli met MI's Dewald Brevis, who is nicknamed Baby AB, after getting out to him in their IPL 2022 clash on Saturday. Kohli was adjudged LBW out on what was Brevis' first-ever delivery in IPL. "Young man! Good one, eh! Good first meeting. [Getting] me on the first ball," Kohli was heard telling Baby AB.

33.title: Bridge over dry river bed collapses as 138-wheel lorry crosses it in MP
33.article_body: A British-era bridge in Madhya Pradesh's Narmadapuram collapsed when a 138-wheel lorry was crossing it on the dry Sukthwa river. No injury was reported in the incident, Additional Superintendent of Police Awadhesh Pratap Singh said. After the incident, vehicular traffic was affected on the Bhopal-Nagpur highway and traffic was being diverted via Harda to Betul.

34.title: India accounts for 114 space debris, lowest in the last 4 years: NASA
34.article_body: Indian space assets account for 114 space debris, according to the latest issue of Orbital Debris Quarterly News published by NASA's Orbital Debris Program Office. India's contribution to space debris has fallen to the lowest levels in the last four years, the data showed. Earlier, NASA had said that India's anti-satellite test in 2019 had created "dangerous" space debris.

35.title: Jr NTR liked my story for 'NTR31', have been his big fan: Prashanth
35.article_body: Filmmaker Prashanth Neel, talking about his upcoming film with Jr NTR, has said the actor liked his story. "Please don't ask me about the genre of that movie because it's far off at the moment," he stated about the film that is tentatively titled 'NTR31'. Prashanth revealed he is a "big fan" of the actor for the last 20 years.

36.title: PM Modi & Biden to hold virtual meet tomorrow to 'deepen ties'
36.article_body: US President Joe Biden will hold a virtual meeting with PM Narendra Modi on Monday to "further deepen ties between our governments, economies, and our people", a US official said. "Biden will continue our close consultations on...consequences of Russia's brutal war against Ukraine," the official added. The meeting will precede the India-US 2+2 Ministerial Dialogue, the official further said.

37.title: Soni Razdan asked not to discuss it: Mukesh Bhatt on Alia-Ranbir wedding
37.article_body: Alia Bhatt's uncle filmmaker Mukesh Bhatt, on being asked about her wedding with Ranbir Kapoor, has stated that he is not in a position to say anything at this time. "My sister-in-law (Soni Razdan) has asked to refrain from discussing anything about this marriage," Mukesh added. Alia and Ranbir are reported to get married on April 14 in RK Studios.

38.title: BJP govt in UP has failed on all fronts: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav
38.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday said that the Uttar Pradesh government has failed on all fronts and the BJP is insensitive towards the problems of the youth. Yadav further said that BJP wants to rule the state by making people feel afraid, "which is highly condemnable in a democracy," adding that BJP has defamed UP.

39.title: Ram Janmbhoomi Temple's construction will be completed by Dec 2023
39.article_body: The construction of the Ram Janmbhoomi Temple in Ayodhya is in full swing and will be completed by December 2023, Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra General Secretary Champat Rai said. "Efforts are being made to install Lord Ram's idol in the sanctum sanctorum of the temple in 2023," Rai added. Construction work was interrupted earlier due to the pandemic.

40.title: 17-yr-old beaten by girl's family over suspected relationship in Guj
40.article_body: Gujarat's Panchmahal Police on Sunday arrested five people for allegedly assaulting a 17-year-old boy and two of his friends on the suspicion that he was in a relationship with a girl from the village. Police registered an FIR after a video that purportedly shows the boy and his friends being beaten with sticks surfaced online, reports said.

41.title: Cattle smuggler killed in gunfight with police in Assam's Dhubri
41.article_body: A suspected cattle smuggler was killed in a gunfight with police in Assam's Dhubri district, officials said on Sunday. According to police, the deceased was shot in self-defence by officials, who were chasing the vehicle the former was travelling in the previous night. Over 40 people have been killed due to police action in state since May 2021, PTI reported.

42.title: People scream from their windows after a week of total lockdown in Shanghai
42.article_body: A video reportedly showing residents in China's Shanghai screaming from their balcony windows has gone viral online. The city of 26 million residents has been under total COVID-19 lockdown for a week and people aren't allowed to leave their homes even for essential supplies. Another video showed a drone appealing to people to 'control their soul's desire for freedom'.

43.title: I have craved for this day when I'm head down in work: Raj Arjun
43.article_body: Actor Raj Arjun has stated that he has craved the day when he is head down in work since his initial days. He added the rise of OTT has turned the tide in favour of artistes who fall back on their talent and grit. "Today, I am in a position where I can ask for a bound script," Raj said.

44.title: DC defend biggest total of IPL 2022 vs KKR as Kuldeep takes 4 wickets against his ex-team
44.article_body: DC defeated KKR by 44 runs to end their two-match losing streak and move to the sixth position on the IPL 2022 points table. DC put up the biggest total of IPL 2022 after scoring 215/5 in their 20 overs. DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav took four wickets against his former team as KKR were dismissed for 171 in 19.4 overs.

45.title: Sunak moves out of official UK residence amid row over Akshata's taxes: Reports
45.article_body: British Chancellor of the Exchequer Rishi Sunak has moved out of his Downing Street residence in London along with his family amid a row over his wife Akshata Murty's taxes, reports said on Sunday. Removal vans were reportedly spotted outside Sunak's Downing Street flat. Reports said the family will move into their newly-renovated luxury flat in Kensington.

46.title: Pro-Russian protests in Germany amid conflict in Ukraine
46.article_body: Pro-Russian protesters gathered in Germany on Sunday to protest against discrimination in the country towards Russians following the invasion of Ukraine. The protests included a 350-car motorcade, flying Russian and also a few German flags, in Hanover city. Around 2.35 lakh Russian citizens live in Germany, according to government statistics from late 2020.

47.title: Nitish Kumar will be CM till NDA govt exists in Bihar: JD(U) leader
47.article_body: Nitish Kumar will hold the post of Chief Minister of Bihar till the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) government remains in the state, Janata Dal (U) leader Upendra Kushwaha said on Sunday. He added that BJP was not pressurising Kumar to leave the post. "There is no dispute within JD(U) for the Chief Minister post in Bihar," Kushwaha said.

48.title: Have two pitches for Mahesh Babu: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli
48.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli, speaking about his upcoming project with actor Mahesh Babu, has said that he has two pitches for the actor. "When 'RRR' was postponed due to Omicron variant, my father Vijayendra Prasad, ordered me not to stay idle at home. We started dabbling with a couple of ideas," Rajamouli stated. "Both of them are exciting...large-scale movies," he added.

49.title: Driver falls from road roller, dies after coming under its wheels in UP
49.article_body: The driver of a road roller died after he fell from the vehicle and came under its rear wheel in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi on Saturday. The 40-year-old man lost control over the vehicle after a high-tension electric wire fell on it. He was working on a rural road project in the Gopiganj area of Bhadohi.

50.title: Russia seeking to recruit discharged soldiers amid Ukraine war: UK
50.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry claimed on Sunday that Russia is seeking to strengthen its troop numbers in Ukraine by recruiting military personnel who were discharged from services in 2012. Russia is also trying to employ soldiers from Transnistria, a breakaway region in Moldova, the ministry further claimed. This comes amid reports of Russia regrouping its troops in eastern Ukraine.

51.title: UK FM Sunak considered resigning over criticism of wife's tax status: Report
51.article_body: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak considered whether he should resign after facing criticism over his wife Akshata Murty's non-domiciled tax status, The Sunday Times reported. "He was considering whether he could withstand his family taking this any more," the newspaper quoted a source as saying. Murty's non-domiciled tax status meant she didn't have to pay UK taxes on global earnings.

52.title: UK probes leak of Finance Minister Sunak's wife's tax affairs: Reports
52.article_body: The UK has reportedly launched a Whitehall inquiry into how the tax affairs of Finance Minister Rishi Sunak's wife Akshata Murty were leaked to the media. Sunak was recently criticised after it was revealed that Akshata holds a non-domiciled status in the UK. Following the row, Akshata said that she will start paying UK taxes on her overseas income.

53.title: New Pak govt will not indulge in politics of revenge: Shehbaz Sharif
53.article_body: Shehbaz Sharif, who has been nominated as the next PM of Pakistan, on Sunday claimed that the new government in the country will not indulge in politics of revenge. "I don't want to go back to bitterness of...past. We want to forget them and move forward," he said. Earlier, Imran Khan had lost the no-trust vote in the National Assembly.

54.title: LSG to bowl first against RR, both teams make two changes
54.article_body: LSG won the toss and elected to bowl first against RR in their IPL 2022 clash. LSG have made two changes to their playing XI, with Marcus Stoinis and Dushmantha Chameera replacing Evin Lewis and Andrew Tye, respectively. RR have also made two changes, with Rassie van der Dussen and Kuldeep Sen replacing Yashasvi Jaiswal and Navdeep Saini, respectively.

55.title: Each of 403 Assembly segments in UP to have 100-bed hospitals: Yogi
55.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Sunday inaugurated a statewide health campaign and said that each of the 403 Assembly segments in UP will have a 100-bed hospital. "Encephalitis came under control in the past four years. The deadly encephalitis will be eradicated forever in one to two years," Yogi said while launching the Jan Arogya Mela in UP.

56.title: My wife Maanayata pushed me to do 'K.G.F: Chapter 2': Sanjay Dutt
56.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt has revealed that his wife Maanayata Dutt pushed him to do the upcoming film 'K.G.F: Chapter 2'. The actor further said that the journey of the film has been a lesson for him after 45 years. "This film was made as a family," he added. This is Sanjay's first film since his recovery from lung cancer.

57.title: Japan & Philippines agree to enhance defence cooperation at 2+2 meeting
57.article_body: Japan and the Philippines agreed to enhance their defence cooperation at the countries' first-ever 2+2 meeting in Tokyo on Saturday. The countries affirmed their commitment to ensuring a "free and open Indo-Pacific" region, according to a statement released by Japan's Foreign Ministry. Notably, the countries have maritime disputes with China in the East and South China seas.

58.title: EV retail sales witness three-fold jump in FY22: Industry body
58.article_body: Federation of Automobile Dealers Association (FADA) said electric vehicle (EV) retail sales in India witnessed a three-fold jump YoY from 1,34,821 units sold in FY21 to 4,29,217 units sold in FY22. "Total EV sales had stood at 1,68,300 units in FY20," it further said. Tata Motors led the segment with 15,198 units sold and a market share of 85.37%.

59.title: Wish I could tell myself at 23 not to be impulsive: Raveena
59.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon has stated that when she was 23 years old, she was a grounded person but super sensitive and a bit impulsive. "I wish I could tell myself then that work in time heals everything and tell myself not to be impulsive," she added. The actress further said she had to deal with yellow journalism at the time.

60.title: 27-yr-old Pune woman harassed over extra marital affair dies by suicide
60.article_body: A 27-year-old woman in Pune died by suicide after allegedly being harassed by her husband and in-laws for being involved in an extra-marital affair, police said. Investigating Officer API Manohar Sonwane said that the accused have been arrested for harassing her mentally and physically, which led the victim to take the extreme step.

61.title: AAP leader attacked with chopper by 3 minors in Pune
61.article_body: President of Aam Aadmi Party's social justice wing in Pimpri Chinchwad, Yashwant Shrimant Kamble was allegedly attacked with a chopper by three minors when he was returning home from a protest on Saturday. Kamble was returning on his two-wheeler when motorcycle-borne attackers came from behind and hit him with a sharp weapon believed to be a chopper, reports said.

62.title: UK PM travels in train to reach war-hit Ukraine; video of train surfaces
62.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson travelled on a train from Poland to Ukraine to meet the war-hit country's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy recently. In a clip shared by the Ukrainian Railways online, the UK PM said, "I am travelling on a fantastic train through to Kyiv from Poland." On meeting Zelenskyy, Johnson said, "Ukrainians have shown the courage of a lion."

63.title: Chris Rock jokes about Will Smith's Oscars slap, says 'got my hearing back'
63.article_body: Comedian Chris Rock joked about actor Will Smith slapping him at the 94th Academy Awards during a recent standup show. "I'm okay...I'm not talking about [the slapping incident] until I get paid. Life is good. I got my hearing back," Chris joked. This comes after Will received a 10-year ban from attending the Oscars because of the incident.

64.title: Protest outside Sri Lankan Prez's office continues for 2nd day
64.article_body: Sri Lankan protesters continued to occupy the entrance of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's office for a second day on Sunday amid a severe economic crisis in the country. The crisis has led to a shortage of essential items in Sri Lanka. "We will stay on, we will leave only when we have chased them out," a 32-year-old former soldier said.

65.title: Thane woman killed, 2 injured as portion of adjoining house collapses
65.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was killed and two other persons were injured after the balcony of an adjacent house collapsed on their residence in the Thane district of Maharashtra on Sunday, officials said. The injured persons were taken to a local hospital, from where they were shifted to Mumbai for further treatment. One of the injured persons is aged 45.

66.title: Qutub Minar was built after demolishing 27 Hindu-Jain temples: VHP
66.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad Spokesman Vinod Bansal on Sunday said Qutub Minar was built "with material obtained after demolishing 27 Hindu-Jain temples". "Qutub Minar was actually 'Vishnu Stambh'...The superimposed structure was built just to tease the Hindu community," Bansal added. He also demanded that the 27 demolished temples be rebuilt and Hindus be allowed to offer prayers there.

67.title: 12 crude bombs used for killing pigs found in a field in Pune
67.article_body: Pune's Dighi Police recovered 12 crude bombs, used to kill pigs and stray animals, popularly known as dukkar (pig bombs), from Wadmukhwadi on Friday. According to the police, the bombs were spotted by a woman, whose five-year-old daughter was killed by the same explosives in February, when the child tried to play with it, not knowing it was a bomb.

68.title: Pics show Kapoors' bungalow being lit up ahead of Ranbir, Alia's rumoured wedding
68.article_body: Pictures have shown lights being put up at a bungalow belonging to actor Ranbir Kapoor's family, ahead of his rumoured wedding with Alia Bhatt on April 17. Visuals showed Krishna Raj Bungalow being lit up, even as reports said that some wedding rituals will be performed there. The couple will reportedly move into the bungalow after their wedding.

69.title: NCB busts illegal drug supply chain in Kolkata, arrests 4 people
69.article_body: Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) busted an illegal drug supply chain in Kolkata and arrested four people on Friday. NCB raided a godown of accused, identified as Minagur Rahaman, who is allegedly involved in retail sale of psychotropic substances, and recovered injections, cough syrups and capsules. One of the seized drugs is used to treat addiction to opioids, NCB added.

70.title: Delhi govt’s parent outreach programme yet to cover 250 schools
70.article_body: A report on the Delhi government's parent outreach programme launched last year found that it is yet to cover 250 schools. A report submitted by the Delhi Commission for Protection of Child Rights said that out of the 1,068 government schools, School Management Committee (SMC) members and school mitras had done no interactions with parents in 250 schools.

71.title: K'taka govt hands over probe into B'luru road rage killing to CID
71.article_body: The Karnataka government has handed over the probe into the road rage incident, in which a 22-year-old man was killed in Bengaluru to CID, state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said. "I have instructed higher officials of the police department. Our officials have collected evidence," he added. The victim was stabbed to death by three men in JJ Nagar on Tuesday.

72.title: Sony TV's Kaun Banega Crorepati registrations are now open
72.article_body: Sony Entertainment Television has opened online registrations for the upcoming fourteenth season of Kaun Banega Crorepati. Starting April 9, host Mr. Amitabh Bachchan will ask a new question everyday at 9pm, giving aspirants a chance to be India's next crorepati with the power of their knowledge, Sony Entertainment Television announced.

73.title: Delhi Capitals record highest total of IPL 2022
73.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) put up a total of 215/5 against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) on Sunday to record the highest total of IPL 2022 so far and their fourth highest total in IPL history. It is the eighth time that DC have scored more than 200 runs in an innings in IPL. DC slammed 11 sixes in their innings today.

74.title: Coinbase suspends UPI payments option in India days after launch
74.article_body: US-based crypto exchange Coinbase has disabled the option to buy cryptocurrencies using UPI method in India. The development comes days after Coinbase launched its trading services in India and said it would allow users to buy crypto using UPI. After the launch, the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) had clarified it wasn't aware of any crypto exchange using UPI.

75.title: India's 5th richest man Damani reduces Blue Dart stake, hikes stake in VST: Report
75.article_body: Radhakishan Damani, DMart owner and India's fifth-richest person with a net worth of $20 billion according to Forbes, has increased his shareholding in Hyderabad-based cigarettes company VST Industries, The Economic Times reported. He bought 12,000 equity shares of VST Industries during the January-March period. He decreased in logistics company Blue Dart Express in the March 2022 quarter.

76.title: Russian helicopters destroy Ukrainian military convoy: Report
76.article_body: A convoy of Ukrainian military vehicles was destroyed by Russian attack helicopters, a news agency reported on Sunday, citing Russia's Defence Ministry. Videos published by the ministry showed helicopters flying at low altitude, launching missiles and firing from guns at ground targets. However, the location and the timing of the attack was not specified.

77.title: NC will welcome those who want to strengthen pluralistic J&K: Farooq
77.article_body: National Conference (NC) chief Farooq Abdullah said on Saturday that party will welcome those who want to strengthen the idea of a united, democratic and pluralistic Jammu and Kashmir. Abdullah added that NC's vision is to protect the social, cultural and political interests of people from all regions and religions. He made the remarks at a party event in Jammu.

78.title: Revamped bus stop inaugurated in Mumbai; 105 more to come up soon
78.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday inaugurated the revamped bus stop of Famous Studio in Mumbai's Worli and promised such "sleek bus stops in another 105 locations" across Mumbai. He also inaugurated the revamped Shri Shantinath Chowk and Late Smt Sunita Dattaji Nalawade Manoranjan Maidan. These projects are part of Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation's Tactical Urbanism Initiative.

79.title: Did 1 scene with Rishi Kapoor, wasn't starstruck but excited: Isha
79.article_body: Actress Isha Talwar has stated that she did one scene with late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor in the film 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. "I was there when he was shooting his other scenes and I was doing something else on those days," she added. Isha further said that she grew up watching him act and dance and she wasn't starstruck but excited.

80.title: Freedom struggle begins again: Imran Khan after being removed as Pak PM
80.article_body: Ousted Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Sunday made his first remarks after losing a no-confidence motion against him in the country's Parliament. "Pakistan became an independent state in 1947, but the freedom struggle begins again today against a foreign conspiracy of regime change," tweeted Khan. "It's always the people of the country who defend their sovereignty and democracy," he added.

81.title: Have chances to win championship: Ferrari's Leclerc after Aus GP win
81.article_body: After winning the 2022 F1 Australian Grand Prix, Ferrari's driver Charles Leclerc has said that his team "have chances" to win the championship. "Obviously, we're only at the third race so it's difficult to think about the championship, but...we've got a very strong car," he stated. The last time Ferrari won the championship was back in 2007 with Kimi Räikkönen.

82.title: Very good player for future: Plessis after Anuj Rawat's 66(47) vs MI
82.article_body: RCB skipper Faf du Plessis has praised opener Anuj Rawat after his 47-ball 66 in RCB's seven-wicket win over Mumbai Indians in IPL 2022. "Anuj has potential...Comes down the wicket, shows intent, he's a very good player for the future," Du Plessis stated. In the ongoing tournament, the 22-year-old has scored 113 runs in four innings so far.

83.title: Dulquer's next film with Mrunal, Rashmika titled 'Sita Ramam'
83.article_body: Director Hanu Raghavapudi and his production team announced the title of their next film on the occasion of Ram Navami on Sunday. The film, titled 'Sita Ramam', stars Dulquer Salmaan, Rashmika Mandanna and Mrunal Thakur. The makers also shared a glimpse of the upcoming project, which revolves around the characters of Dulquer and Mrunal, who play Ram and Sita, respectively.

84.title: MI came back from behind to win IPL 2015, but that team was different: Irfan
84.article_body: Following Mumbai Indians' four consecutive defeats in IPL 2022, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan recalled MI's IPL 2015 campaign where the team lost their first four matches, but still managed to lift the trophy. "In IPL 2015, they were in...similar situation...but that team was a little different," Irfan stated. Mumbai are yet to win a match in the ongoing tournament.

85.title: Fielding is where game vs KKR will be won or lost: DC's David Warner
85.article_body: David Warner said Delhi Capitals will be looking to "outfield" Kolkata Knight Riders in the IPL 2022 match on Sunday. "Fielding is...big component...that's where...game will be won or lost," Warner stated. DC have won one out of their three matches in the tournament so far. "We can't afford to get too far behind in terms of wins," he added.

86.title: FPIs invest ₹7,707 cr in April after 6-month-long selling streak
86.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) turned net buyers between April 1-8 and invested ₹7,707 crore in Indian equities after a six-month-long selling streak. FPIs put in ₹1,403 crore in the debt markets in the period under review after pulling out net ₹8,705 crore in February and March 2022. Between October 2021 and March 2022, FPIs withdrew net ₹1.48 lakh crore.

87.title: We're like Lagaan team, intention was to win: Yash on KGF's success
87.article_body: 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' actor Yash, speaking about the film series' success, has said that they are like the team in 2001 film 'Lagaan' as their intention was to come and win. He added that they didn't have many resources but pushed his director's work. "I had to convince him to take KGF to India and...we went full out," Yash said.

88.title: Several people join Ram Navami procession in B'luru; video surfaces
88.article_body: Several people joined the Ram Navami procession which was taken out in the Padmanabhanagar area of Bengaluru on Sunday. A video shows people chanting slogans of 'Jai Shri Ram' while taking part in the procession. BJP MP from Bengaluru South Tejasvi Surya and Karnataka Minister R Ashoka also joined the procession.

89.title: 2 terrorists linked to attack on CRPF troops, shot dead in Srinagar
89.article_body: Two terrorists, linked to a recent attack on the CRPF troops, were shot dead in Srinagar on Sunday, tweeted the Kashmir Zone Police. "They belonged to Pakistan and were from Lashkar-e-Taiba. Both were gunned down. Our personnel have become a soft target for terrorists. Militancy is declining and we'll ensure it dwindles further," said IGP (Kashmir) Vijay Kumar.

90.title: NGT forms panel to probe encroachment of wetlands in GB Nagar
90.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has ordered the setting up of a joint committee of UP officials to file a report on alleged encroachment of 117 water bodies and wetlands in Gautam Buddha Nagar. The committee has been asked to submit the report in two months. The committee has been also asked to mention the measures taken for their protection.

91.title: American skater Alysa Liu retires aged 16, says 'It has been an insane 11 years'
91.article_body: World Championships bronze medallist figure skater Alysa Liu of the US has announced her retirement aged 16. "I started skating when I was five so that's about 11 years on the ice and it's been an insane 11 years," she wrote on Instagram. "I feel so satisfied with how my skating career has gone," the two-time US national champion added.

92.title: Janhvi Kapoor, Varun Dhawan's 'Bawaal' goes on floors in Lucknow
92.article_body: The shooting of Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor-starrer 'Bawaal' has begun on Sunday. Director Nitesh Tiwari's wife Ashwiny Iyer took to her Instagram handle to announce the commencement of the shoot. Reportedly, In India, the filming is scheduled to happen in three different locations. Apart from India, the shooting of 'Bawaal' will take place in four European places including Paris.

93.title: BJP to fight Himachal elections under CM Thakur's leadership: Nadda
93.article_body: BJP President JP Nadda has said that the party will contest this year's Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections under CM Jai Ram Thakur's leadership. "He (Thakur) will not be replaced and the BJP will contest the Assembly elections under his leadership," Nadda said. "10-15% BJP MLAs did not get tickets in UP...and it is likely to happen here too," he added.

94.title: Gotabaya govt to blame for Sri Lanka's economic crisis: Ex-PM
94.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe on Sunday accused incumbent administration of being responsible for Sri Lanka's economic crisis due to its "incompetence", adding that people want President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to resign. "When I left the office in 2019, we had a surplus budget," he added. Sri Lanka is experiencing a shortage of essential items, including food supplies, medicines and fuel.

95.title: 'Star Trek', 'As The World Turns' actress Kathryn Hays passes away at 87
95.article_body: Veteran American actress Kathryn Hays, known for her pivotal roles in 'Star Trek' and 'As The World Turns', has passed away at the age of 87. According to Deadline, she died on March 25 in Fairfield, Connecticut. Kathryn Hays is survived by her daughter and son-in-law, three grandchildren, and a great-grandson, as per Deadline.

96.title: Is that a punishment: Colin Jost on Will Smith's 10 year Oscar ban
96.article_body: After Will Smith was banned from attending Academy events for 10 years, Colin Jost joked about The Academy's decision stating that the ban wasn't the best way to punish him. He said, "Is that a punishment? He can still be nominated...He just doesn't have to attend the four-hour ceremony where someone is...going to make fun of his wife again."

97.title: Ferrari driver Charles Leclerc wins Australian Grand Prix
97.article_body: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc claimed his second win in the ongoing Formula One season by winning the Australian Grand Prix on Sunday. The Monaco-born racer secured his fourth career win by more than 20 seconds ahead of the runner-up Sergio Perez. Red Bull's Max Verstappen had to retire mid-way after his car started having some technical problems.

98.title: Elon Musk is now $100 billion richer than Jeff Bezos: Forbes
98.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is now nearly $100 billion richer than Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos, according to Forbes' Real-Time Billionaires List. Musk's net worth is now pegged at $282 billion while Bezos' net worth is at $183.6 billion. Musk, who started with a net worth of $26.6 billion in 2020, saw his wealth soar during the COVID-19 pandemic.

99.title: Strange cloud formation appears over mountain in US, locals share pics
99.article_body: Locals in US' Alaska shared pictures of a strange cloud-like formation that appeared above the Lazy Mountain, prompting a police investigation into its origin. After theories suspecting a UFO crash or a Russian weapon surfaced online, the Alaska State Troopers issued a statement, saying, "A contrail from a commercial jet combined with the rising sun...caused the unique atmospheric sight."

100.title: I've never yelled like that in my life: Shastri recalls scolding MSD for playing football
100.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri recalled scolding MS Dhoni for playing football ahead of an Asia Cup final match. "There was dew...he went skidding five minutes before the toss. I've never yelled like that in my life. I said, 'Stop the game!'" Shastri said. "He loves it...The intensity with which he plays football scares you from the outside," he stated.

101.title: 'Everyone loves Deepika' dialogue wasn't improvised; it was in script: Abhishek
101.article_body: On 'The Kapil Sharma Show', comedian-host Kapil Sharma asked Abhishek Bachchan about the dialogue 'Everyone loves Deepika' and questioned, "Was this dialogue a part of...[Dasvi] script or did you improvise it?" To which Abhishek replied, "No, no, it was there in the script. Otherwise, I would've taken the name of someone else. After all, I've to go back home."

102.title: Why administer booster dose only through pvt hospitals: Congress
102.article_body: Congress spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi has criticised the BJP-led Centre for not allowing government hospitals to administer COVID-19 vaccine booster dose. "Why administer this booster dose only through private hospitals and have no option of getting it through government hospitals. Does it make sense?," asked Singhvi. He further accused this policy of being "discriminatory" towards poor people.

103.title: Entire European project is Russia's target: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
103.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday said that Russia's aggression is not limited to Ukraine but that the "entire European project" is Russia's target. He added that this is why everyone must support Ukraine as it's "a strategy of defence for every civilized state". Russia's use of force is "a catastrophe that will inevitably hit everyone", he further said.

104.title: Pune's atheist meet may disturb law & order on Ram Navami; postponed
104.article_body: An atheist conference scheduled in Pune on Sunday has been postponed, as the city police feared that "organising the event on the day of Ram Navami festival could cause law and order problems," organisers said. An organiser, Dr Nitin Hande said, "The police also said some Hindutvawadi outfits have taken objection to the event."

105.title: Ayesha Takia's husband alleges racism at Goa airport, says 'officer tried to touch wife'
105.article_body: Actress Ayesha Takia Azmi's husband Abu Farhan Azmi alleged CISF officers of racism after calling his name "out loud" at Goa airport. "Altercation started when an armed male officer...tried to physically touch & tell my wife, son to stand in another line," he tweeted. He also alleged that a guard "made a dirty sexual comment" while checking his pockets.

106.title: Not scared of any ban: Cong leader who questioned Irani on petrol prices in flight
106.article_body: Netta D'Souza, the Acting President of All India Mahila Congress who questioned Union Minister Smriti Irani on a flight about increasing petrol and LPG prices, tweeted, "Not scared of any ban. I'll keep showing Mirror of Truth to Modi Govt & its Ministers!" D'Souza was responding to a Twitter user who said she could be handed a six-month flight ban.

107.title: Need to close situations: Zaheer Khan after MI's loss against RCB
107.article_body: After Mumbai Indians suffered their fourth straight loss in IPL 2022, team director Zaheer Khan said that the franchise needs to close situations when the momentum begins to shift away. "You’ve got to be able to close those moments of the game...We’ve...not been able to do that... It’s a long season, need to keep things tight," Zaheer said.

108.title: Deepika shares poem she wrote in class 7, says it was her 'first & last' attempt
108.article_body: Deepika Padukone took to Instagram on Sunday to share a poem that she wrote in her childhood. The actress mentioned that it was her "first and [the] last attempt at writing poetry". "This was in grade 7. I was 12. The poem was titled 'I Am'. We were given...first 2 words that you see...and the rest is history," Deepika wrote.

109.title: Happy to have Faf as opening partner: RCB batter Anuj Rawat
109.article_body: RCB opener Anuj Rawat has said that he is "really happy" that captain Faf Du Plessis is his opening partner. "It feels great to be a part of RCB. Opening with Faf and having players like Virat...it’s a great feeling for me," Rawat said. "Finally...I was having the same mindset as (that of) previous games," he added.

110.title: Ayush Badoni has all qualities of a future star: Harbhajan
110.article_body: Former India cricketer Harbhajan Singh has said that he believes the Lucknow Super Giants' 22-year-old batter Ayush Badoni has the qualities of becoming a "future star". "Badoni is a very confident player...(don't) get the feeling that this is his debut season. He has this quality to absorb pressure which is a sign of...a future star," Harbhajan said.

111.title: Plea in Pak court to stop ex-PM Imran Khan from leaving country
111.article_body: The Islamabad High Court will hear a plea seeking to prevent former PM Imran Khan and some ministers of the erstwhile government from leaving the country, according to reports. The petition demands Khan, former ministers Shah Mahmood Qureshi and Fawad Chaudhry to be put on the exit control list. This comes after Khan lost no-confidence motion in the National Assembly.

112.title: Bryan, Aaron to reprise 'Breaking Bad' roles in 'Better Call Saul' final season
112.article_body: 'Breaking Bad' actors Bryan Cranston and Aaron Paul are set to return as Walter White and Jesse Pinkman in the final season of spin-off series 'Better Call Saul'. Confirming the news, the show's Twitter account shared a picture of Bryan and Aaron with a message that read, "They're coming back." Bob Odenkirk plays the lead role in 'Better Call Saul'.

113.title: Woman charged with murder in US' Texas for abortion; protest held
113.article_body: A protest was held outside a sheriff's office in US' Texas over a 26-year-old woman being allegedly charged with murder after authorities said she had caused the "the death of an individual by self-induced abortion". In Texas, abortions are banned as early as six weeks. Lizelle Herrera was arrested on Thursday with a bond set at $500,000 (nearly ₹3.8 crore).

114.title: Deeply disappointed in Putin, he seemed to be man of peace: Ex-Italy PM
114.article_body: Ex-Italian PM Silvio Berlusconi has said that he's deeply disappointed in Russian President Vladimir Putin amid ongoing Ukraine war, adding that Putin had seemed to be "man of democracy and peace” to him. "The...Ukraine [war], instead of bringing Russia into Europe has thrown it into...arms of China," Berlusconi added. Berlusconi had termed Putin "number one among world leaders" in 2015.

115.title: COVID-19 is a 'bahurupiya' disease, never know when it'll resurface: PM Modi
115.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday urged people not to let their guards down in the battle against COVID-19 and called it a 'bahurupiya' (form-changing) disease. "Coronavirus was a big crisis and we aren't saying that [it's] over," PM said at a virtual event. He added, "It may have taken a pause, but we never know when it will resurface."

116.title: Dylan wishes fiancée Kristen on b'day, says 'Time looks good on you'
116.article_body: Actress Kristen Stewart celebrated her 32nd birthday with her fiancée Dylan Meyer. Taking to Instagram, Dylan shared a post with Kristen with a picture where they are seen leaning in for a kiss over a birthday cake. She captioned the post, "Another one around the sun and you're out here getting flyer every year. Time looks good on you."

117.title: Important to fight together as BJP trying to weaken Opp'n: Kharge
117.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Sunday said the Opposition must "fight together...[as BJP-RSS] are trying to see to it that only one party remains". Reacting to BSP chief Mayawati's comments that Congress should worry about itself, Kharge said, "Congress has always been with people." He asserted that Congress had indeed invited Mayawati to lead the anti-BJP alliance in Uttar Pradesh.

118.title: Brie Larson joins 'Fast & Furious 10', Vin says 'Welcome to the family'
118.article_body: Brie Larson, who plays Captain Marvel in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, has joined the cast of 'Fast & Furious 10'. Actor Vin Diesel took to Instagram on Sunday to share the news. "You have no idea how timeless and amazing she will be in our mythology...Welcome to the FAMILY Brie," he wrote. The upcoming instalment will also feature Jason Momoa.

119.title: Ghaziabad completes 100% 1st dose vaccination for those aged 15-18
119.article_body: Ghaziabad district has completed administering the first dose of COVID-19 vaccination to 100% of those in 15-18 age group. "There were delays in completing...first dose target as many children didn't turn up," a senior official said. "We've to keep in mind that their annual school examinations are nearing and that is why there was a little delay," the official added.

120.title: Rajasthan man shoots woman dead for refusing to marry him; later kills self
120.article_body: A 30-year-old killed himself after shooting a woman dead as she had refused to marry him in Rajasthan's Jodhpur. Both the deceased knew each other for the last five years. As per preliminary investigation, the man, who was married and had two children, wanted to marry the woman and also suspected her of having an affair with another man.

121.title: Fire breaks out at banquet hall in Delhi, no casualty reported
121.article_body: A fire broke out at a banquet hall near the Peeragarhi Chowk in Delhi on Sunday morning, officials said. They added that no casualty was reported in the incident. The fire services department received a call about the incident at 11 am and seven fire-tenders were sent to the spot, Delhi Fire Services Director Atul Garg said.

122.title: Noida Authority successfully carries out test blast at Supertech twin towers
122.article_body: A test blast to demolish the illegally-built Supertech twin towers in Noida was successfully carried out around 2.30 pm on Sunday. Edifice Engineering and Jet Demolition were roped in by Noida Authority for this purpose. The test blast was carried out to ascertain the amount of explosives needed for the towers' actual demolition, which will take place on May 22.

123.title: Smugglers throw cows from truck during high-speed police chase in Gurugram
123.article_body: A video has surfaced of a high-speed police chase of cattle smugglers, in which cows are seen being thrown out of their truck by the smugglers. The 22-km-long chase took place in Gurugram's Cyber City area early on Saturday and the accused reportedly drove the truck with deflated tires. Five people were arrested at the end of the chase.

124.title: There's some extra love in the air: Ayan on Alia & Ranbir's Brahmāstra poster
124.article_body: Amid Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding reports, the couple's close friend and filmmaker Ayan Mukerji dropped a new poster of Brahmāstra. Sharing the poster featuring Alia and Ranbir together, Ayan wrote, "Brahmāstra is about the Energy of Love. A love, that spreads like fire...The time feels right for it...There is some extra love in the air these days!"

125.title: Delhi Police arrests 76, recover 1.4 kg of ganja in last 24 hrs
125.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 76 persons for robbery, snatching, liquor smuggling and recovered 1.425 kilograms of ganja in the last 24 hours, according to data released by their official Twitter account. Moreover, Delhi Police arrested 17 proclaimed offenders, seized 979 quarters of illicit liquor and recovered 11 stolen vehicles. Emergency help was given on 4,829 calls, the post added.

126.title: First round of presidential elections underway in France
126.article_body: Voting for the first round of presidential elections started on Sunday. Around 4.8 crore citizens are eligible to vote in the contest between 12 candidates, including the incumbent President Emmanuel Macron and prominent leaders like Marine Le Pen and Jean-Luc Melenchon. If no candidate manages to get over 50% votes, a second round will be held between the top two.

127.title: 9-year-old girl writes letter to mother killed in Ukraine, says 'I'll never forget you'
127.article_body: A nine-year-old girl has written a letter to her mother who was killed in Russia's war in Ukraine, saying "I'll never forget you." She added, "I'll do my best to be a good person and get in heaven too. See you in heaven!" The letter was shared by Anton Gerashchenko, an adviser to the Minister of Internal Affairs of Ukraine.

128.title: Congress leader questions Smriti Irani on rising petrol, LPG prices in flight
128.article_body: Netta D'Souza, the Acting President of All India Mahila Congress, questioned Union Minister Smriti Irani on a flight about increasing prices of petrol and LPG. Irani initially said that D'Souza was "blocking the way", and when the minister was asked about "stoves without gas", she said, "please don't lie". Recently, petrol prices were hiked 14 times in 16 days.

129.title: I wish somebody was there to guide me: Taha Shah Badussha
129.article_body: Actor Taha Shah Badussha, who made his debut in 2011 film 'Luv Ka The End', has said that he joined the industry when he was 20 but wishes he could when he was 14. "Looking back, I believe everything that happened was to make me stronger. I also wish somebody was there to guide me," the actor added.

130.title: Hyderabad man posts morphed photos of woman online, arrested
130.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police have arrested a man for allegedly harassing a woman by posting morphed photos of her across social media platforms. The 28-year-old accused, who took screenshots from video calls between him and the woman, posted photos after victim refused to engage in further conversations with him. According to police, accused also sent the same photos to victim's husband.

131.title: No FBI team is in India to probe Karnataka Bitcoin scam case: CBI
131.article_body: The CBI said the US' Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has not sent any team to India to conduct a probe into an alleged Bitcoin scam case that is being investigated by Karnataka Police. Several Congress leaders earlier claimed the FBI is in India to investigate the Bitcoin scam, which the party alleged the Karnataka BJP government had covered up.

132.title: New Delhi civic body starts 'Suvidha Camp' for grievance redressal
132.article_body: The New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) on Saturday began a two-week 'Suvidha Camp' at its Convention Centre on Jai Singh Road. The NDMC received 114 grievances on the first day of the camp, according to officials. "All grievances were discussed face-to-face between the public and the concerned officials of the NDMC departments for expeditious resolutions," an official said.

133.title: Don't try to break homes: Prakash Raj on Amit Shah's Hindi remark
133.article_body: Actor-politician Prakash Raj on Friday tweeted, "Don't try to break homes, Mr Home Minister. We dare you #stopHindiImposition. We love our diversity, we love our mother tongue, we love our identities." His tweet comes after Union Home Minister Amit Shah's statement that people of different states should communicate with each other in Hindi and not English.

134.title: SP not working for Muslims, alleges party's Lok Sabha MP Barq
134.article_body: Samajwadi Party MP Shafiqur Rahman Barq has accused his own party of not "working for Muslims". "I am not satisfied with the working, the entire Samajwadi is not working for Muslims," the Lok Sabha MP said after he voted for the UP Legislative Council elections on Saturday. He also accused the Yogi Adityanath-led government of not "doing justice with Muslims".

135.title: Table-toppers KKR to bowl first against seventh-placed DC, playing XIs announced
135.article_body: Table-toppers KKR won the toss and elected to bowl first against seventh-placed DC in their IPL 2022 clash in Mumbai on Sunday. KKR, who have won two matches in a row, are playing with an unchanged side. DC, who have lost two matches in a row, have made one change to their playing XI, with Khaleel Ahmed replacing Anrich Nortje.

136.title: U'khand CM performs 'kanya poojan' at Dehradun house; pics surface
136.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Sunday performed 'kanya poojan' at his residence in Dehradun on the occasion of Ram Navami. He also shared pictures of the event, saying, "I pray that the blessings of Maa Durga always remain on all of us." On Ram Navami, the ninth day of Chaitra Navaratri, nine girls representing Goddess Durga's avatars are worshipped.

137.title: KKR's ₹8-cr buy Nitish Rana needs to show more responsibility: Aakash
137.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Aakash Chopra has said that KKR batter Nitish Rana needs to show "more responsibility" in the ongoing IPL 2022. "Nitish has been purchased for ₹8 crore...He is not doing the job yet," Aakash stated. The 28-year-old, who was KKR's third-highest run-scorer in IPL 2021, has scored 39 runs in four innings in IPL 2022 so far, averaging 9.75.

138.title: Language chauvinism will boomerang: KTR on Amit Shah's Hindi remark
138.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Sunday criticised Union Home Minister Amit Shah's remark that people of different states should communicate with each other in Hindi and not English. Rao said, "Language chauvinism/hegemony will boomerang." He asked, "Why don't we let people of our great nation decide what to eat, what to wear, who to pray to...what language to speak!"

139.title: Hyd Police bust IPL betting racket, seize materials worth ₹1.20 crore
139.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Saturday arrested five persons from the city's Vanasthalipuram area for being allegedly involved in an IPL betting racket. Police also seized cash and other items worth ₹1.20 crore from accused's possession. One of the accused had opened two current bank accounts in the name of two trading entities to run racket and mislead authorities, police said.

140.title: Woman shares pics of 14-yr-old son's bruised hand, smashed phone after Ronaldo's outburst
140.article_body: After Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo smashed the phone out of a boy's hand in frustration after 0-1 loss against Everton, the mother of the boy shared pictures of his bruised hand and smashed phone. The woman revealed that her 14-year-old son was in complete shock and couldn't digest what happened as he is autistic and has got dyspraxia.

141.title: Police constable harasses woman officer over WhatsApp in Mumbai; booked
141.article_body: A police constable has been booked for allegedly harassing a woman police officer over WhatsApp and stalking her in Mumbai. The Khar Police said a case has been registered against him under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code and the IT Act. The constable has not been arrested yet, the Khar Police added.

142.title: We need 1% increase of rates: Kotak as RBI raises inflation forecast to 5.7%
142.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak questioned the RBI's decision to raise retail inflation projection and keep repo rates unchanged. "RBI policy: Sharp increase in inflation estimate to 5.7%...Present repo rate at 4%," Kotak tweeted. "If India has to move to 0% real rate that is, inflation - interest rate = 0, we need 1% increase of rates," he added.

143.title: BharatPe has put the Ashneer row behind & posted record growth: CEO
143.article_body: BharatPe posted record growth in FY22, is on track to break even and list on stock exchanges in the next 18-24 months after putting behind the controversy around Co-founder Ashneer Grover, CEO Suhail Sameer said. He added that his priority is BharatPe's employees so that they stay focused. "Business in Q4 FY22 is up 20% on every metric," Sameer said.

144.title: How did a gang steal a 60-feet bridge in Bihar?
144.article_body: A gang dismantled a 60-feet iron bridge in Bihar and likely sold it in parts as scrap metal. The robbers, posing as government officials with the irrigation department, "came with heavy machinery, gas cutters and worked for two days during daytime to dismantle the bridge," Reuters quoted a villager. The bridge was built over a water canal three decades ago.

145.title: Had an affair with a director; even got pregnant: Lock Upp contestant Mandana
145.article_body:
'Lock Upp' contestant Mandana Karimi spoke about the time she was going through a separation from her husband and revealed that she had a secret affair with a filmmaker at that point. "My relationship was with a...director who talks about women's rights," she said. "We 
 planned...pregnancy," Mandana revealed in the promo, which ended with shots of those around her crying.

146.title: 'Adipurush' director shares fan-made posters showing Prabhas' look as Lord Ram
146.article_body: On the occasion of Ram Navami, 'Adipurush' director Om Raut took to Twitter and shared some fan-made posters showing Prabhas' look as Lord Ram. "Celebrating the victory of good over evil #ramnavami," he wrote. The film, an adaptation of 'Ramayana', will feature Prabhas as Lord Ram and Saif Ali Khan as Lankesh. It also stars Kriti Sanon and Sunny Singh.

147.title: Supriya Sule to inaugurate Symbiosis elderly care centre in Pune on Apr 12
147.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) MP Supriya Sule will inaugurate the Symbiosis Centre for Geriatric Care in Pune on April 12. Several senior citizen clubs, 'Hasya Yoga' groups and those running old-age homes will be felicitated at the event. A senior doctor said that all the services will be provided within a well-confined area to ensure accessibility at the centre.

148.title: BMC to install rooftop solar panels on toilet blocks in Goregaon
148.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to install rooftop solar panels on street toilet blocks in Mumbai's Goregaon area. A BMC official said that the initiative is being carried out to utilise space and clean energy. "The rooftops of toilet blocks have little use...Most land ends up becoming storage space or has no use at all," the official said.

149.title: Palestinians set fire to West Bank shrine: Israeli military
149.article_body: The Israeli military on Sunday claimed that about 100 Palestinians marched towards a West Bank shrine and set it on fire. This comes amid the escalating tension between Israel and Palestine during the holy month of Ramzan. "The vandalism of Joseph's Tomb is a grave event and a serious violation of freedom of worship," said Israel's Defence Minister.

150.title: MNS plays 'Hanuman Chalisa' outside Shiv Sena’s Mumbai office; 2 detained
150.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) played 'Hanuman Chalisa' on a loudspeaker outside Shiv Sena's headquarter in Mumbai on the occasion of Ram Navami on Sunday. The Mumbai Police stopped the 'Hanuman Chalisa' and detained MNS leader Yashwant Killedar and a taxi driver. This comes after MNS chief Raj Thackeray called for the removal of loudspeakers from mosques.

151.title: Distributing freebies policy decision of parties, can't intervene: EC tells SC
151.article_body: The Election Commission (EC) informed the Supreme Court that distributing freebies is a policy decision of a political party and that it doesn't have the power to intervene. "Whether such decisions are financially viable or have an adverse effect, has to be decided by voters," the EC added. Such an action would be an overreach of its powers, it claimed.

152.title: Shehbaz Sharif nominated as new Pakistan PM by country's Opposition
152.article_body: The Leader of Opposition in the National Assembly of Pakistan, Shehbaz Sharif, has been nominated as the next PM of the country after Imran Khan was dismissed as Pakistan's PM on Sunday. Sharif is the president of the Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) party. Khan became the first Pakistani PM to lose the no-trust vote in Parliament.

153.title: Italian Embassy counsellor robbed off her handbag in Delhi; 2 arrested
153.article_body: A 54-year-old counsellor working at the Italian Embassy was robbed of her handbag by unidentified persons at Delhi's Barapullah flyover. The victim was heading home in an auto from her office when one of the accused robbed her of her handbag containing her phone, ID cards, debit cards and gold jewellery. Police have arrested two persons in this connection.

154.title: 26-year-old man arrested for invading pitch and giving fist bumps to Kohli, Rohit
154.article_body: A 26-year-old man has been arrested by Pune Police for invading the pitch during MI-RCB match on Saturday. He was booked by police on charges of trespassing and creating ruckus as he was seen giving fist bumps to Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma before being escorted out. A police official said that the fan also manhandled the policemen on duty.

155.title: Traffic to be suspended for 30 mins for test blast at Noida twin towers today
155.article_body: Traffic movement will be suspended for 30 minutes, from 2.15-2.45 pm on Sunday, around Supertech's twin towers in Noida, where a test blast would be carried out around 2.30 pm. The area will be cordoned off by police. "Traffic movement will be restricted from ATS junction to Gejha Phool Mandi and from Eldeco Chowk to Sector 108," an inspector said.

156.title: Reports claim Imran Khan tried to remove Pakistan Army chief, he denies
156.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan tried to dismiss Army chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa but a notification was not issued by the Defence Ministry, reports said. However, according to Geo News, Khan told journalists, "There was neither any talk of dismissing the Army chief nor was this on the cards." Khan lost the no-confidence vote and was removed as Pakistan's PM.

157.title: The Kashmir Files is the real game changer, not RRR: Ram Gopal Varma
157.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma believes the success of 'The Kashmir Files' is "the real game changer" being made on a small budget of ₹10 crore. "RRR isn't a game-changer and...I don't think it can bring about a change. It's a film that's produced on a lavish scale." "Whereas, if you consider 'The Kashmir Files'...It gives filmmakers... much-needed confidence," he said.

158.title: 2 minor boys drown in lake while swimming with friends in Thane
158.article_body: Two boys, aged 11 and 12 years, drowned while swimming in a lake in Thane, police said on Sunday. The incident took place when six boys from Dhamankar Naka entered the Varaladevi lake for a swim. While four of the boys came out of the lake after swimming, they informed police as they were unable to locate the two others.

159.title: Pune locals protest as BJP corporator renames garden after father
159.article_body: Residents of Pune's Salisbury Park have been protesting for the past three weeks after BJP corporator Shrinath Bhimale renamed a PMC garden after his father, late Yashwantrao Bhimale, and put up a board with the name on it. A resident forum's chairman said that while they acknowledged Bhimale's efforts for the garden, its renaming seemed like "an attempt to hog..limelight".

160.title: Alia respects everyone a lot, she's not jealous of anyone: Neetu
160.article_body: Neetu Kapoor said in an interview that actress Alia Bhatt is a very sweet and nice girl. She added that the 29-year-old actress respects everyone a lot and is not jealous of anyone. "Ranbir too is a kind-hearted guy. They both make a great pair," Neetu further said. The couple will reportedly get married in an intimate ceremony this week.

161.title: Anupam shares pic with Big B, Neena; fan says 'History of cinema in 1 pic'
161.article_body: Anupam Kher, taking to Instagram, shared a selfie with the cast of his upcoming film, 'Uunchai'. The picture featured Amitabh Bachchan, Boman Irani, Neena Gupta and Sarika. "May your day feel as good as taking a perfect selfie of perfect happy moments," Anupam wrote. Reacting to his post, a fan wrote, "History of cinema in this one picture is remarkable."

162.title: Cong should worry about itself: Mayawati on Rahul's UP alliance offer comment
162.article_body: A day after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said BSP chief Mayawati didn't respond to the party's alliance offer in Uttar Pradesh during elections, Mayawati said the Congress needs to worry about itself first. "The Congress must think 100 times before making such comments. They've been unable to win against the BJP, but they just keep taking these potshots," she added.

163.title: Ukraine says 12 soldiers returning after prisoner swap with Russia
163.article_body: Ukraine's Deputy Prime Minister Iryna Vereshchuk said that 12 of the country's soldiers are coming home following a prisoner exchange with Russia on Saturday. Apart from soldiers, Vereshchuk said that 14 civilians were also returning to Ukraine as part of the deal. This was the third such prisoner swap since the war began, she added.

164.title: Mumbai's Mithi river polluted for last 11 years: MPCB report
164.article_body: A report published by the Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB) has revealed that Mumbai's Mithi river has remained 'polluted to heavily polluted' for the past 11 years. The 17.8 km long river was found once (2012-13) in the non-polluted category in the past 11 years. The water quality index (WQI) of the river was 44 in 2020-21, the report said.

165.title: Amrinder Singh Brar appointed as Congress’ Punjab chief
165.article_body: Three-time MLA Amrinder Singh Brar, also known as Raja Warring, was appointed as the Congress' new Punjab chief by party President Sonia Gandhi on Saturday. Warring served as the Transport Minister in the previous state government. Meanwhile, Pratap Singh Bajwa was appointed as the leader of legislature party, while Raj Kumar as its deputy leader.

166.title: Comedian Munawar Faruqui confirms on 'Lock Upp' he is married and has a son
166.article_body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui, during an episode of 'Lock Upp', confirmed he is married and has a son. "I'm not hiding anything, but we've been separate for the past one-and-a-half years. The matter is in court and I don't want to discuss that. It has been difficult," Munawar said. He later suggested that he is doing the show for his son.

167.title: BJP MP shares video of 92-yr-old man completing 5 km-run in B'luru
167.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya on Sunday shared a video of a 92-year-old man completing a 5 km run at Bengaluru Marathon, saying, "[Sri Dattatreya Ji] truly symbolises the spirit of grit and determination of every Bengalurean." In the video, Surya can be seen holding Dattatreya's hand while they crossed the finish line. Surya added that Dattatreya had "outpaced" many others.

168.title: Karan shares pic of Farah shopping for 'designer wear' on New York Streets
168.article_body: Karan Johar shared a picture of choreographer-director Farah Khan as she shopped on the streets of New York. Taking to Instagram Stories, Karan posted a photo of Farah standing near a roadside shop selling sunglasses. Alongside it, he wrote, "Caught you! Shopping for high-end designer wear! Show off @farahkhankunder." Sharing Karan's post, Farah wrote, "I live for your comments @karanjohar."

169.title: Dozens of Ukrainian civilians found in grave near Kyiv
169.article_body: A grave with dozens of Ukrainian civilians has been found in Buzova village near Kyiv, the latest reported mass grave to be discovered as Russian forces retreat, an official said. Ukraine said Russia is gathering its forces in the east for a major assault and urged people to flee. UK PM Boris Johnson met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday.

170.title: RCB's Harshal Patel leaves IPL bio-bubble after death of a family member
170.article_body: RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel has left the IPL bio-bubble following the death of a family member. Harshal exited the bubble after getting to know about the tragedy in the family after the match against MI on Saturday night, PTI reported. Harshal is expected to join the bubble before RCB's next match.

171.title: YouTube blocks Russian parliament's Duma TV; Russia criticises
171.article_body: YouTube has blocked Russia's lower parliament house's broadcast channel Duma TV, saying that it was "terminated" for violating the terms of service. "YouTube has signed its own warrant," Russia's Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova said. Russian leader Vyacheslav Volodin also reacted to it, saying that this shows that the US is trying to achieve a "monopoly of information".

172.title: Fire breaks out at Ghazipur landfill site in Delhi for 2nd time in 2 weeks
172.article_body: Another fire broke out at the Ghazipur landfill site in Delhi on Saturday late night, nearly two weeks after a massive fire broke out at same site which took firefighters nearly 48 hours to extinguish. The Saturday's fire was put out within three hours after Delhi Fire Service (DFS) officials sent four fire tenders to the spot within 10-15 minutes.

173.title: We're planning such that foreigners will seek jobs in Punjab: Mann
173.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Saturday called for the stop of the "brain drain" from the state, saying, "We're planning in such...way that foreigners will come here for jobs." Following this, Congress MLA Sukhpal Khaira criticised the remark, saying, "Hope foreigners approach...but...we've to set our house in order." Mann claimed that ₹15 lakh was lost per person going abroad.

174.title: Hope I can move on: Amber shares statement ahead of Johnny Depp Defamation Case
174.article_body: Amber Heard said she hopes she and her ex-husband Johnny Depp can move on from their defamation trials, which are set to begin on April 11. On Saturday, she wrote, "I've always maintained a love for Johnny and it brings me great pain to have to live out the details of our past life together in front of the world."

175.title: IIT-Kanpur's annual cultural fest Antaragni is being held from Apr 8-10
175.article_body: Celebrating its 56th edition with the theme of 'A Nouvelle Rhapsody', IIT-Kanpur's annual cultural festival 'Antaragni' is being conducted in a hybrid mode for the first time ever. It offers a virtually immersive experience of the IIT-Kanpur Campus with all events, online and offline, being streamed on the platform. Key highlights include performances from artists Ritviz and Sunidhi Chauhan.

176.title: 'RRR' crosses ₹1,000-crore mark globally in 16 days
176.article_body: SS Rajamouli-directorial 'RRR' has crossed the ₹1,000-crore mark globally in 16 days of its release.
