The Ram Charan and Jr NTR-starrer 'RRR' is the third Indian film after 'Dangal' and 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion' to earn ₹1,000 crore worldwide. 'Dangal' is the highest-grossing Indian film of all time with over ₹2,000-crore worldwide earnings.

177.title: Jaffer shares scene from Yuvraj's movie as child actor; jokes about MI, CSK's losses
177.article_body: Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share a scene from Yuvraj Singh's Punjabi movie 'Mehndi Shagna Di' to joke about MI and CSK losing their first four matches each in IPL 2022. In the scene, Yuvraj, standing with his friend, tells their teacher, "We've taken an oath that if we win, we'll win together, if we lose, we'll lose together."

178.title: David Beckham's son Brooklyn marries actress Nicola Peltz, pics from wedding surface
178.article_body: Former England football team captain David Beckham's eldest son Brooklyn tied the knot with American actress Nicola Peltz in Palm Beach. Tennis player Serena Williams, Spice Girl Mel C, fashion designer Rachel Zoe and TV chef Gordon Ramsay were among those who attended the wedding ceremony. The couple had got engaged in July 2020.

179.title: Amit Shah inaugurates Indo-Pak border viewing project at Gujarat's Nadabet
179.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday inaugurated the border viewing point on the India-Pakistan international border in Nadabet in Gujarat's Banaskantha district. The viewing point has been made on the lines of the one at Punjab's Wagah Border. According to officials, the project was developed as a tourist attraction destination at a cost of ₹125 crore by Gujarat's tourism department.

180.title: Hope you're blessed with everything: Samantha on Naga's brother Akhil's b'day
180.article_body: Samantha Ruth Prabhu, who parted ways with her ex-husband Naga Chaitanya in 2021, has penned a note on the occasion of Naga's actor-brother Akhil Akkineni's birthday. The actress, taking to her Instagram Stories, wrote, "Happy birthday Akhil. Wishing you the very best this year. I hope and pray you are blessed with everything you are looking for. God Bless."

181.title: We can also take action against Kejriwal in BJP-ruled states: Singh
181.article_body: After Punjab Police booked BJP leader Naveen Jindal, the party's West Delhi MP Parvesh Sahib Singh has said that BJP can also file FIRs against AAP leaders but the party doesn't believe in "low-level politics". "We've BJP governments in more than half of the states...we can take action against [Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal] there," he added.

182.title: 300-yr-old Karaga festival begins at Bengaluru's Dharmaraya temple
182.article_body: The 300-year-old Karaga festival began at the Dharmaraya Swamy Temple in Bengaluru on Saturday. The festival was held exclusively within the temple in the last two years owing to the Covid-19 pandemic. However this year, the organisers will take out the 'Hasi Karaga' (procession) on April 14 while the 'Karaga Shakyotsava' (the main event) will be held on April 16.

183.title: China records 1,351 new COVID-19 cases, highest in Shanghai
183.article_body: China recorded 1,351 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday, including 1,318 locally transmitted and 33 imported infections, said the country's health authorities. Shanghai, which has been put under a strict lockdown, saw 1,006 locally confirmed cases, the highest of all cities. 242 cases were reported in Jilin, 16 in Zhejiang, 10 in Guangdong, and three in Beijing.

184.title: Nana Patekar to make comeback with social-thriller 'The Confession'
184.article_body: Actor Nana Patekar is set to make an acting comeback with a social-thriller, titled 'The Confession'. It will be directed by Ananth Narayan Mahadevan, who has helmed films like 'The Xpose', 'Aksar' and 'Dil Maange More!!!'. The 71-year-old actor had reportedly taken a break from acting after actress Tanushree Dutta accused him of sexual harassment during the #MeToo movement.

185.title: Australian PM Scott Morrison calls for elections on May 21
185.article_body: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison has called for federal elections to be held on May 21. Morrison said that Governor-General David Hurley, who he met on Sunday at his residence, accepted his advice on setting the election date. Following the announcement, the opposition - Australian Labor party - tweeted, "It's time for better Medicare. It's time for better aged care."

186.title: Iceland Cricket mock third umpire over Virat Kohli's controversial dismissal
186.article_body: Iceland Cricket mocked the third umpire over ex-RCB captain Virat Kohli's controversial dismissal against MI. Iceland Cricket tweeted, "It's not easy for on-field umpires to detect inside edges or whether ball hit bat or pad first. But every TV umpire should be able to make the right call with the benefit of slow motion replays and technology like UltraEdge."

187.title: UGC India's Twitter account briefly hacked; 3rd govt account targeted in 2 days
187.article_body: The official Twitter account of University Grants Commission (UGC) India was briefly hacked on Sunday. The account's display and background pictures were changed to photos of cartoons and a long thread of tweets were posted, tagging numerous Twitter users. This comes after the Twitter accounts of Uttar Pradesh CM's Office and India Meteorological Department's (IMD) were hacked on Saturday.

188.title: Big B sends handwritten letter to Nimrat praising her performance in 'Dasvi'
188.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan recently sent a handwritten letter to Nimrat Kaur along with some flowers to praise her 'exceptional work' in her latest film 'Dasvi'.  "Your work in 'Dasvi' is exceptional - nuances, gestures, all! My deep admiration and congratulations," he wrote in the letter. Nimrat also penned a note thanking Amitabh for sending her flowers and letter for the film.

189.title: Musk takes poll to turn Twitter HQ in San Francisco into homeless shelter
189.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has started a poll on his Twitter account asking whether the firm's San Francisco headquarters should be converted into a homeless shelter. The poll read, "Convert Twitter SF HQ to homeless shelter since no one shows up anyway." The poll has got over 6.6 lakh votes till now, with over 91% answering yes.

190.title: Aus PM cooks PM Modi's 'favourite khichdi' to celebrate India trade deal, shares pics
190.article_body: Australia PM Scott Morrison took to Instagram to reveal that he celebrated his country's new trade agreement with India by cooking Indian dishes. "The curries I chose to cook for curry night...are all from my dear friend Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Gujarat province, including his favourite khichdi," he wrote. "Good job, looks delicious," an Instagram user commented.

191.title: Won't spare anyone: Telangana Minister to pubs after Hyd drug bust case
191.article_body: After the recent drug bust by the police inside a Hyderabad pub, the state's Tourism and Excise Minister V Srinivas Goud has said that they "won't spare anyone". "If need be, we will shut down everything...It's not about revenues, but the...reputation of Telangana," Goud said during a review meeting with the representatives of various pubs and bars of Hyderabad.

192.title: Johnny Lever, Rajpal Yadav arrive together at an event, fan says 'Comedy Kings'
192.article_body: Actors Johnny Lever and Rajpal Yadav, who have appeared together in films like 'Coolie No.1' and 'Hungama 2' met on Thursday at an event. A paparazzo account shared a video featuring Johnny and Rajpal from the event. The video received a lot of appreciation. One of the fans called them, "The Bollywood legends of laughter." Another user commented, "Comedy Kings."

193.title: CBI books 10 persons over TMC leader's murder that preceded Birbhum violence
193.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has registered an FIR against 10 persons in connection with TMC panchayat leader Bhadu Sheikh's murder, which allegedly led to the killing of nine persons in West Bengal's Birbhum, a senior official said. The CBI visited Rampurhat police station and collected the case diary and documents linked to Sheikh's murder investigation, the official added.

194.title: Class 10 girl killed by a speeding truck on way to exam in Surat
194.article_body: A Class 10 girl, who was going to the exam centre to write her Hindi board exam, was killed by a speeding truck near Bhesan village road in Surat. The deceased, Pragati Sadashiv (16), was going on a moped with her uncle to Segva village when the truck hit them, police said. Her uncle, Chhagan Rathod, has suffered serious injuries.

195.title: India reports 1,054 new COVID-19 cases, 29 deaths in last 24 hours
195.article_body: India has reported 1,054 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1,258 recoveries and 29 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 1,150 COVID-19 cases and 83 deaths. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the country stands at 11,132, while the death toll reached 5,21,685.

196.title: Gurugram records 44.5°C, second hottest April day in 43 years
196.article_body: Gurugram witnessed its second hottest day recorded in the month of April in 43 years as the maximum temperature hit 44.5°C on Saturday. According to India Meteorological Department, the last time the city saw a higher temperature was in 1979 when it recorded 44.8°C on April 28. The maximum temperature was 10°C above the average normal, added IMD.

197.title: Right-wing workers vandalise Muslim traders' carts at K'taka temple
197.article_body: Members of the right-wing group, Sri Ram Sene, on Saturday allegedly vandalised the carts of Muslim traders outside a Hanuman temple in Karnataka's Dharwad. A video of the incident was shared online, which shows smashed watermelons on the road. "I've been doing business in front of this temple for...15 years and never had a problem," a watermelon seller said.

198.title: Women police station in Noida gets new daycare centre
198.article_body: A daycare centre for children has been started at the women police station in Noida's Sector 39. This is the second such facility in Gautam Buddha Nagar after the one in Surajpur was opened last year. DCP Vrinda Shukla said that the facility was conceptualised in January and subsequently set up with the help of a private firm.

199.title: Spain's Barcelona to ban smoking on all of its 10 beaches
199.article_body: Authorities in Spain's second-largest city Barcelona have announced that they'll ban smoking on all of the city's 10 beaches from this year. This comes after a pilot project in which smoking was banned at four beaches. "Beaches with no smoking allowed will offer healthier communal living areas, with less waste and will respect the defence of the environment," authorities said.

200.title: Harbhajan Singh asks Ashish Nehra what Rahul Tewatia eats, GT respond with a pic
200.article_body:
After GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia slammed two sixes on the last two deliveries to help his team defeat PBKS, Harbhajan Singh asked GT head coach Ashish Nehra what Tewatia eats. GT responded to Harbhajan with a screengrab from one of their videos wherein Tewatia can be seen eating fafda. "
Psst! It's a secret. Don't tell anyone," GT wrote.

201.title: What does the law say regarding Kohli's controversial dismissal against MI?
201.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli was declared LBW out against MI's Dewald Brevis by third umpire, who stated that he can't overturn on-field umpire's decision as ball hit the bat and pad simultaneously. As per MCC's rules, if the ball makes contact with the striker's pad and bat simultaneously, this shall be considered as the ball having first touched the bat.

202.title: Video shows Ronaldo smashing fan's phone after Manchester United's defeat
202.article_body: A video has surfaced which purportedly shows Cristiano Ronaldo smashing a fan's phone following Manchester United's 1-0 defeat to Everton at Goodison Park on Saturday. "I'd like to apologise for my outburst and, if possible, I would like to invite this supporter to watch a game at Old Trafford as a sign of fair-play and sportsmanship," Ronaldo said on Instagram.

203.title: discovery+ docuseries to uncover lesser-known mysteries around Ramayana
203.article_body: Ahead of Ram Navami, discovery+ has announced its docuseries 'Legends Of The Ramayana' narrated by author Amish Tripathi. Subscribers can watch the series, shot across India and Sri Lanka, to uncover questions like 'what is the name of Shri Rama's sister?,' 'what's the mystery behind Rama Setu stones?,' 'why did Shri Rama's vanvaas last 14 years?' and more such mysteries.

204.title: 5 hurt, several trapped as part of building collapses in Punjab; casualties suspected
204.article_body: At least five persons sustained injuries and several others were left trapped under debris after a portion of an under-construction building of a private university located on Airport Road in Punjab's Mohali collapsed on Saturday late night. Rescue workers were rushed to the spot immediately after the incident. "We suspect that there are casualties," a police officer said.

205.title: I'll be there whenever he wants me: Neetu on working with son Ranbir
205.article_body: When asked if she plans to work with her son, actor Ranbir Kapoor someday, actress Neetu Kapoor said that she would love to do it anytime. "Whenever he wants me, I will be there," she said. Neetu further added that she recently shot an advertisement with Ranbir and she just loved the experience of working with him.

206.title: Shweta Bachchan shares mom Jaya's pic from her NCC days on her b'day
206.article_body: Shweta Bachchan took to Instagram on Saturday to wish her mother, Jaya Bachchan, on her 74th birthday. She shared some old pictures of Jaya and wrote, "Mother, may you always smile like you've made best NCC cadet or like you have a huge plate of crabs to devour." Actor Abhishek Bachchan also wished Jaya on her birthday.

207.title: Section 144 imposed in Rajasthan's Jaipur till May 9 after Karauli violence
207.article_body: The Jaipur administration on Saturday imposed Section 144 of CrPC till May 9, in view of the violence that broke out in Rajasthan's Karauli last week, injuring several people. The order has suspended the gathering of crowds, protests, assemblies and processions without prior permission in the area. Wedding celebrations and mournings will be exempted, according to the order.

208.title: Pune records 40 new COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths
208.article_body: Pune district saw 40 new COVID-19 cases and four deaths, the health department said on Saturday. The total number of cases recorded so far stood at around 14.5 lakh, while the death toll from the infection reached 20,538. There are currently 235 active cases. Over 1.78 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses have been administered in the district.

209.title: Big B shaped the way I thought about cinema: KGF 2 director on Sholay
209.article_body: 'KGF 2' director Prashanth Neel spoke about how Ramesh Sippy's 'Sholay' and Amitabh Bachchan changed the way he saw cinema. He said, "Amitabh Bachchan shaped the way I thought about cinema. One thing...Sholay did was, to tell...Indian audience...you can make...Hollywood movies in India with Indian emotions." "I didn't think I'd make KGF this early in my career," he added.

210.title: 466 live corals seized from Dubai passengers at Pune airport
210.article_body: As many as 466 live corals were seized from two passengers arriving from Dubai on April 5 by customs officials at Pune airport. According to an official, at least 100 corals were kept in a glass jar while 366 were in a plastic bag. The corals, protected under Wildlife Protection Act, have been sent for rehabilitation at Mumbai's Taraporevala Aquarium.

211.title: Car crashes into truck in Pune; all 4 occupants of the car killed
211.article_body: All four occupants of a car were killed after the vehicle crashed into a stationary truck from behind at high speed on the Pune-Mumbai Expressway in Pune's Gahunje on Saturday, an official said. "The driver of the truck said that his vehicle had a breakdown after which it had halted," the official added. The incident took place around 3.45 pm.

212.title: Imran Khan left Pakistan PM's official home an hour before losing no-trust vote
212.article_body: Imran Khan vacated the Pakistan Prime Minister's official residence almost an hour before he lost a no-confidence vote in the National Assembly, a senior leader from his party, Faisal Javed Khan, said on Sunday. After Speaker Asad Qaiser handed over the reins to Opposition's Ayaz Sadiq, it seemed the voting on no-trust motion would go ahead and Khan would lose.

213.title: Duo wanted in 25 cases arrested for cheating senior citizens in Navi Mumbai
213.article_body: Two men were arrested for cheating senior citizens by claiming a murder was reported in their area and urging them to hand over their valuables for their own safety. The accused were wanted in 25 cases in Navi Mumbai. They allegedly wrapped the valuables in a handkerchief for the victims and handed over another bundle that had stones or papers.

214.title: Virat Kohli gets angry after controversial dismissal, reaction goes viral
214.article_body: A video of RCB batter Virat Kohli's reaction to his controversial dismissal against MI went viral. In the video, Kohli can be seen smashing bat on the ground in anger and muttering continuously on his way back to the pavilion. Kohli was dismissed LBW after third umpire didn't overturn the original decision, saying ball touched the bat and pad simultaneously.

215.title: Fans question whether Virat Kohli's LBW dismissal against MI was out or not
215.article_body: RCB's Virat Kohli was adjudged LBW out by the on-field umpire during his team's match against MI on Saturday. Kohli took a review, with the third umpire sticking with the decision made by the on-field umpire, saying that the ball hit the bat and pad simultaneously. "Kohli is always a victim of controversial LBW calls (atrocious umpiring)," a fan tweeted.

216.title: Traffic on Delhi-Gurugram highway disrupted for hours after crane catches fire
216.article_body: Traffic on the Delhi-Gurugram expressway (NH-48) came to a halt on Saturday after a 50-tonne 18-wheeler hydraulic crane allegedly caught fire near Delhi's Mahipalpur. "We tried removing it with five-seven cranes, but...it couldn't be removed. We've now brought in a larger crane," a police officer said. Commuters going from Gurugram to Delhi reportedly remained stranded for hours on the highway.

217.title: Baby AB takes Virat Kohli's wicket on his first-ever delivery in IPL
217.article_body: MI's 18-year-old batter Dewald Brevis, who is nicknamed Baby AB, dismissed RCB's Virat Kohli on his first-ever delivery in IPL. Kohli was adjudged LBW out for 48(36) on Brevis' delivery. The South African bowled three deliveries in the match, conceding eight runs and taking a wicket. RCB defeated MI by seven wickets.

218.title: B'luru man who raped 13-yr-old daughter while wife was away jailed
218.article_body: A 51-year-old man from Bengaluru, who is accused of repeatedly raping his 13-year-old daughter while his wife was reportedly at her parental home, has been sentenced to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment. The incident occurred in 2015. It is believed that the wife hadn't wanted to report the matter to the police, however, a neighbour informed a child welfare committee.

219.title: Senior police officer removed over protest outside Pawar's Mumbai home
219.article_body: Mumbai Police Joint Commissioner (Law & Order) Vishwas Nangre Patil on Saturday removed DCP (Zone II), Yogesh Kumar, from his post in connection with the protest by MSRTC employees outside the house of NCP chief Sharad Pawar in Mumbai. Neelotpal, DCP (Detection) of Mumbai Police Crime Branch, has been given the post. Kumar was removed for failing to discharge duties.

220.title: Imran Khan removed as Pakistan Prime Minister after losing no-trust vote
220.article_body: Imran Khan has been removed as Pakistan Prime Minister after he lost the no-trust vote against him in Pakistan's National Assembly. The results of the vote were declared at around 1.30 am IST, with 174 members favouring the resolution of no-trust. With this, Imran became the first Prime Minister in Pakistan's history to be ousted through a no-confidence motion.

221.title: RCB hand MI their 4th straight defeat in IPL 2022, jump to 3rd on the points table
221.article_body: RCB defeated MI by seven wickets to register their third straight victory in IPL 2022. RCB have jumped to the third spot on the points table, while MI joined CSK in losing their first four matches of IPL 2022. Opener Anuj Rawat top-scored for RCB with 66*(47) as RCB chased down the 152-run target in 18.3 overs.

222.title: Global pledging event raises $11 bn to support Ukrainians amid war
222.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Saturday said that a global pledging event raised 10.1 billion euros (nearly $11 billion) to support Ukrainian refugees and internally displaced people in Ukraine. The 'Stand Up For Ukraine' event was convened by the EU and Canadian PM Justin Trudeau. More than 44 lakh people have fled the conflict in Ukraine.

223.title: We'll devise our best plan vs KKR: DC fast bowling coach Hopes
223.article_body: DC fast bowling coach James Hopes said his side will "devise" the best plan against KKR and will look to win the key moments on Sunday. "KKR are a good team...they have two world-class spinners surrounded by a very solid pace attack and some batters who are match-winners," he added. "We haven't played our best cricket yet," Hopes further said.

224.title: AR Rahman's tweet on 'Goddess Tamil' goes viral after Amit Shah's Hindi remark
224.article_body: An illustration of 'Thamizhanangu' (Goddess Tamil) shared by AR Rahman has gone viral on Twitter. Rahman also included a line written by modern Tamil poet Bharathidasan which read, "Beloved Tamil is the root of our existence." This comes after Union Home Minister Amit Shah's statement that people of different states should communicate with each other in Hindi and not English.

225.title: Ross Taylor replies in Hindi to Sachin Tendulkar's tweet on his retirement
225.article_body: Former New Zealand batter Ross Taylor took to Twitter to reply in Hindi to Sachin Tendulkar's congratulatory tweet following his retirement. "Shukria Sachin Bhai, aap ki recognition ke liye," Taylor wrote. He further wrote in English, "To get this message from my favourite player growing up is an absolute honour."

226.title: Relegation-threatened Everton beat Man Utd 1-0 in Premier League
226.article_body: Everton on Saturday beat Manchester United 1-0 in the Premier League to boost their chances of avoiding relegation. Everton are currently 17th in the table, now four points above the relegation zone. Everton's Anthony Gordon scored the winner in the 27th minute. Manchester United are in seventh place after the defeat, three points off fourth place.

227.title: My Infosys stake is testament to my father Narayana Murthy's work: Akshata
227.article_body: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak's wife Akshata Murty said, "My long-standing shareholding in Infosys is not just a financial investment but also testament to my father's (NR Narayana Murthy) work." The couple recently faced criticism over Akshata's 0.9% stake in Infosys and her non-domicile status. Akshata has said that she will start paying UK taxes on all her overseas income.

228.title: Janhvi Kapoor mobbed ahead of store inauguration in Lucknow: Report
228.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor was mobbed by fans and guests ahead of inaugurating a store at a mall in Lucknow, reported ETimes. As per the report, the actress was an hour and a half late for the event and the guests outnumbered the bouncers. The store spokesperson stated that Janhvi's arrival was delayed so she only did a photoshoot and left.

229.title: Jordan's King to undergo urgent surgery for slipped disc in Germany
229.article_body: Jordan's King Abdullah II will undergo urgent surgery for a slipped disc in the back at a hospital in Germany, an official statement announced. "His Majesty had previously been experiencing intermittent pain in the spinal cord after years of parachuting while serving in...Special Forces," it said. "The surgery will be followed by rest for around a week," it added.

230.title: 'RRR' has given 21st century a new pair of Jai-Veeru: Javed Akhtar
230.article_body: Lyricist Javed Akhtar spoke at the 'RRR' success party saying that besides making a memorable film and a game-changer, director SS Rajamouli has given the 21st century another pair of Jai and Veeru. "There are a few films, stars, and directors who are remembered forever," he added. Rajamouli greeted Javed with a hug and touched his feet.

231.title: No one is telling us why he was shot dead: Father of 21-year-old Indian killed in Canada
231.article_body: Jitesh Vasudev, the father of 21-year-old Kartik who was shot dead in Canada, said, "No one is telling us why a young boy was shot dead." He said, "I've received no phone call from Embassy or Canadian authorities." He added, "His bag was left behind and it seems it was not a robbery. It's possible it was a hate crime."

232.title: MI and DC have weakened bowling departments in IPL 2022: Shastri
232.article_body: Ravi Shastri has said MI and DC are the two teams that have a "weakened" bowling department in IPL 2022. He explained that MI without Hardik and Krunal Pandya and Trent Boult are "feeling the heat" as they're lacking that firepower to push. He added that DC are also feeling the same as don't have Kagiso Rabada and Anrich Nortje.

233.title: Owner arrested after pics show horse travelling by train in Bengal
233.article_body: A 40-year-old man, Gafoor Ali Mollah, was arrested by RPF on Friday after pictures showed a horse travelling by train in West Bengal. Mollah's horse travelled 23 km via train after participating in a race. "He has been booked under various sections of Railway Act for creating nuisance in railway property and unauthorised occupation in a train," an official said.

234.title: We're like brothers: Ajay Devgn on being friends with contemporaries
234.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn, speaking about rivalry with his contemporaries, has said that they are all like brothers and are there for each other. He added that he had called Salman Khan a few years ago about releasing a film on Eid. "So many times, Akshay (Kumar) tweets for me, I do for him and others," the actor stated.

235.title: 2 militant associates of Lashkar-e-Taiba arrested in J&K
235.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police on Saturday arrested two militant associates of terror outfit Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) from Beerwah in Budgam district, police said. Incriminating material of LeT, arms and ammunition, including a Chinese pistol and 12 pistol rounds, have been seized from their possession, police added. A case has been registered and an investigation has been launched into the matter.

236.title: We need to work hard on our game: Jadeja on CSK's 4th straight loss
236.article_body: Following CSK's fourth consecutive defeat in IPL 2022, captain Ravindra Jadeja said the team needs to sit down and talk. "I think tomorrow might be a day off. We'll look to improve in both departments...we are all professional cricketers, we need to work hard on our game," he added. Jadeja is yet to lead CSK to a win as captain.

237.title: Jharkhand to hold three-tier panchayat polls from May 14 to 27
237.article_body: The three-tier panchayat polls in Jharkhand will be held from May 14 to May 27 in four phases, the State Election Commission (SEC) announced. Notably, 9,470 seats will be added to the open category as the polls will be held without any reservations for OBCs. The reservations for the seats have been removed in compliance with a Supreme Court order.

238.title: Delhi sees hottest day in 72 yrs in April 1st half with max temperature at 42.4°C
238.article_body: The maximum temperature in Delhi reached 42.4°C on Saturday, making it the hottest day of April's first half in 72 years. Today's temperature broke the previous record for April 1-15 of 41.6°C, recorded on April 8 this year, and April 12 and 13 in 2010. IMD has said that Delhi recorded April's hottest day in five years on Saturday.

239.title: Efforts to unite Opp'n parties have not materialised yet: RJD
239.article_body: RJD leader Manoj Kumar Jha on Saturday said that the efforts to unite the Opposition have not materialised yet. "Opposition parties have to clear their vision for unemployment, inflation, and a better economy, only then opposition unity is possible," he added. Earlier, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi had said discussions were on to unite Opposition parties against the PM and RSS.

240.title: Which are the 10 highest-grossing Indian films worldwide?
240.article_body: According to trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan, 'Dangal' is the highest-grossing Indian film of all time with over ₹2,000-crore worldwide collection. It's followed by 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion' with over ₹1,810 crore and the recently-released 'RRR', which is nearing the ₹1,000-crore mark. 'RRR' is followed by 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan', 'Secret Superstar', 'PK', '2.0' and 'Baahubali: The Beginning'.

241.title: All-round game: Jaffer on SRH opener Abhishek's 50-ball 75 vs CSK
241.article_body: Praising Abhishek Sharma for his 50-ball 75 in SRH's eight-wicket win against CSK in IPL 2022, Wasim Jaffer said it was an all-round game by the SRH opener. "Well played Abhishek! Sweet striker of the ball but packs a punch too. You saw the pull...lofted cover drive...big slog sweep and the flat batted shot over long on," he tweeted.

242.title: Rahul Tewatia should be nicknamed 'Iceman': Sunil Gavaskar
242.article_body: Referring to Rahul Tewatia slamming two sixes on the last two deliveries to help GT defeat PBKS, Sunil Gavaskar said, "What is running through his veins? It's not blood. Ice!" He added, "Tewatia should be nicknamed 'Iceman'." He added, "If there was anybody who was going to take Gujarat home, it was going to be Tewatia."

243.title: Who was Kartik Vasudev, the 21-year-old Indian shot dead in Canada?
243.article_body: Kartik Vasudev, a 21-year-old student from Ghaziabad was shot multiple times outside a subway station in Toronto. Vasudev arrived in Canada in January to study global business marketing and management at Seneca University. He had completed his undergraduate education from IP University in Delhi. Kartik's family said he was a quiet boy who never got into any fights at school.

244.title: The notion of success is very different now: Suchitra Krishnamoorthi
244.article_body: Actress Suchitra Krishnamoorthi, who starred in 1994 film 'Kabhi Haan Kabhi Naa', has said that the notion, concept and consumption of success are very different now. "Now it's not only about films, there are other mediums like TV or OTT to explore one's creativity. I see youngsters on Instagram, YouTube and other mediums doing so well," the actress added.

245.title: I thanked MSD, he said 'I had nothing to do with the decision': Uthappa on CSK buying him
245.article_body: Robin Uthappa revealed that two days after IPL mega auction, MS Dhoni called him to welcome him to CSK. "I said, 'Thank you for having faith in me'. He said, 'I had nothing to do with this decision'," Uthappa added. "Dhoni said, 'If I've anything to do with the decision...people will...think I picked you because you're my friend'," Uthappa stated.

246.title: Anyone will be happy to get him: SRH debutant Jansen on dismissing Dhoni
246.article_body: Pacer Marco Jansen, who took MS Dhoni's wicket on his SRH debut in IPL 2022, said anyone will be happy to dismiss the CSK wicketkeeper-batter. "Nervous at the start, but nice to get the opportunity...there wasn't much swing for me, so I went for...cross-seam route," he added. The 21-year-old pacer posted bowling figures of 4-0-30-1. Dhoni was dismissed at three.

247.title: 4.1-magnitude earthquake hits Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi
247.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 4.1 on the Richter scale hit Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi on Saturday, the National Centre for Seismology (NCS) informed on Twitter. According to the NCS, the earthquake took place at 4:52 pm at a depth of 10 kilometres and around 30 kilometres North-West of Uttarkashi. However, no reports of damage or loss of lives have been reported yet.

248.title: It was some exhibition of quality shots: Irfan on Abhishek's 75 vs CSK
248.article_body: Reacting to Abhishek Sharma's 50-ball 75 against CSK in IPL 2022, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan tweeted, "That was some exhibition of quality shots." The SunRisers Hyderabad opener hit five fours and three sixes during his innings. He was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in SRH's eight-wicket win against CSK at DY Patil Stadium. Notably, It is Abhishek's maiden IPL half-century.

249.title: Most of the 'top' accounts rarely tweet, is Twitter dying?: Elon Musk
249.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk responded to a tweet listing the top 10 most followed Twitter accounts and said, "Most of these 'top' accounts tweet rarely and post very little content." "Is Twitter dying?" Musk, who is now Twitter's largest shareholder, asked. The list was topped by Barack Obama with 131.4 million followers, followed by Justin Bieber and Katy Perry.

250.title: Ghana's viral 'Coffin Dance' meme sells as NFT for $1.04 million
250.article_body: The viral 'Coffin Dance' meme has been auctioned as an NFT (non-fungible token) for 327 Ethereum worth $1.04 million. The video, which shows Ghanian pallbearers dancing while carrying a coffin, went viral during COVID-19. The pallbearers will donate 50% of the proceeds from auction to a Ukrainian charity and their friends in Ukraine, who lost their income after Russian invasion.

251.title: Wrote a letter to Satyajit Ray as a teen but never sent it: Vidya
251.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan has revealed that she wrote a letter to Oscar-winning late filmmaker Satyajit Ray as a teenager but she never sent it. "If I write a letter to Mr Ray today, it would read 'I wish you had lived longer'," the actress added. She further said that she would have loved to work with the filmmaker even today.

252.title: Iran will continue to develop its nuclear industry, says Prez
252.article_body: Iran will continue to develop its nuclear industry for peaceful purposes, according to Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi. "Our knowledge and technology in the nuclear field is not reversible," he said on Saturday. Raisi's comments came as talks between Iran and world powers in Austria's Vienna to revive the 2015 nuclear deal have stalled.

253.title: 'RRR' nears ₹1,000-crore mark, becomes 3rd highest-grossing Indian film: Report
253.article_body: 'RRR' film's worldwide box office earnings hit ₹981.67 crore and it's nearing the ₹1000-crore mark, trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan tweeted on Saturday. 'RRR' beat 'Secret Superstar' and 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' to become the third highest-grossing Indian film of all time, he added. 'RRR' is now reportedly the third-highest grossing Indian film after 'Dangal' and 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion'.

254.title: Video shows drunk man beating police officer in Indore; arrested
254.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media which shows 25-year-old Dinesh Prajapati hitting a police constable, Jai Prakash Jaiswal, after snatching the latter's baton in Indore. The incident happened on Friday afternoon when the motorbikes of both hit one another. Police said Prajapati has been arrested, adding that he was drunk. Jaiswal suffered serious injuries to the head.

255.title: Sri Lanka appoint Chris Silverwood as head coach for 2 years
255.article_body: Ex-England head coach Chris Silverwood has been appointed as head coach of Sri Lanka for a two-year period, the country's cricket board announced on Saturday. Upcoming Sri Lanka-Bangladesh two-match Test series will be Silverwood's first assignment. "I'm very excited to be on board with Sri Lanka...I cannot wait to get over to Colombo and get started," said Silverwood.

256.title: India Meteorological Dept's Twitter account hacked, link to NFT drop shared
256.article_body: The official Twitter handle of India Meteorological Department (IMD) was hacked on Saturday. Hackers removed the profile picture and name from the account. They shared a link to an NFT (non-fungible token) airdrop of the "Beanz Official Collection". Earlier today, the account of Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister's Office was briefly hacked and its profile picture was changed to 'Bored Ape'.

257.title: Better.com, which fired 900 staff over a Zoom call, plans to cut its staff further
257.article_body: Mortgage lending startup Better.com, which fired 900 employees over a Zoom call last year and began firing 3,000 India and US employees last month, plans to cut its workforce further. It's offering some employees as much as 60 days of severance pay and health insurance if they agree to quit. A Better.com spokesperson confirmed the voluntary separation offers to Bloomberg.

258.title: Manchester City-Liverpool PL game biggest of the season: Foden
258.article_body: Ahead of Manchester City-Liverpool Premier League match, Manchester City midfielder Phil Foden said it's the "biggest game" that every footballer wants to play in. "Two teams fighting for the Premier League, very close on points," he added. Table-toppers Manchester City are on 73 points, with just one point lead over second-placed Liverpool. The match will be played on Sunday.

259.title: Decade-old Hindu temple vandalised in Jammu, case registered
259.article_body: A decade-old temple on the outskirts of Jammu was allegedly vandalised by unidentified miscreants on the intervening night of Friday and Saturday, prompting police to file a case. The temple priest noticed the damage caused to the idols in the morning. Police urged people to maintain communal harmony and foil designs of those trying to disturb the peace.

260.title: UK PM Boris Johnson meets Ukraine President Zelenskyy in Kyiv, pic surfaces
260.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during a visit to Kyiv on Saturday. The embassy of Ukraine in London shared a photo of the two leaders meeting face to face, with the caption, "Surprise." "Boris Johnson's visit in Kyiv began just now with a tete-a-tete meeting with President Zelenskyy," an aide of Ukraine President said on Facebook.

261.title: All institutions in hands of RSS, we have to protect them: Rahul
261.article_body: During a book launch event in Delhi, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday alleged that all institutions in India are in the hands of the RSS. He said, "We've to protect the Constitution...To save the Constitution, we've to protect our institutions...But all the institutions are in...hands of RSS." Earlier, Rahul had said that Opposition parties must unite to fight BJP.

262.title: Video shows speeding BMW hitting woman on 2-wheeler after jumping divider in Mangaluru
262.article_body: A CCTV footage has emerged which shows a speeding BMW car jumping over a divider and hitting a woman on a two-wheeler and crashing into another car in Karnataka's Mangaluru on Saturday. The video shows another woman, who was standing on the divider, narrowly escaping from being hit by the speeding car. The woman on the two-wheeler suffered critical injuries.

263.title: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc claims pole position in Aus GP qualifying
263.article_body: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc on Saturday took pole position ahead of Red Bull's Max Verstappen during the qualifying session of the Australian Grand Prix. Verstappen's teammate Sergio Perez finished third ahead of McLaren's Lando Norris in fourth. Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton came fifth with teammate George Russell finishing sixth. "We are again very close with Red Bull," said Leclerc.

264.title: Warnock retires from football aged 73 after 42-year managerial career
264.article_body: Former Queens Park Rangers, Crystal Palace and Sheffield United manager Neil Warnock on Saturday, announced his retirement from football, at the age of 73, after a 42-year managerial career. Warnock has managed more matches in English professional football than anyone else with over 1,600 games. He began his managerial career in 1980. "I've had a good run really," he said.

265.title: Over 44 lakh people fled Ukraine since start of war, says UN
265.article_body: More than 44 lakh people have fled Ukraine since the start of the war in February, according to the UN refugee agency. Of these, around 2.1 lakh are non-Ukrainians. Around 90% of those who have fled Ukraine are women and children, as the Ukrainian authorities do not allow men of military age to leave, according to AFP.

266.title: Mumbai Police records Sanjay Raut's statement in phone tapping case
266.article_body: The Mumbai Police on Saturday recorded the statement on senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut at the office of the party's mouthpiece Saamna. Raut is one of the two politicians whose phones were allegedly tapped illegally by the Maharashtra Intelligence Department when IPS officer Rashmi Shukla was its chief. The recording lasted for nearly one hour, a police officer said.

267.title: Didn't really feel good in the car: Max Verstappen ahead of Aus GP
267.article_body: Red Bull's Max Verstappen said he "didn't really feel good in the car" as he finished second behind Ferrari's Charles Leclerc during the qualifying session of the Australian Grand Prix on Saturday. "I think there's not been one lap where I actually felt confident, a bit of a struggle," Verstappen said ahead of the Grand Prix on Sunday.

268.title: Boris Becker found guilty of four charges in bankruptcy trial in London
268.article_body: Six-time Grand Slam champion Boris Becker was found guilty of four charges in his bankruptcy trial in London after being accused of hiding millions of pounds worth of assets including two Wimbledon trophies to avoid paying debts. Becker, 54, was acquitted of further 20 counts. He was made bankrupt on June 21, 2017. Becker had previously denied the charges.

269.title: Employees shouldn't feel pressured to answer emails late at night: Nadella
269.article_body: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has said that managers need to set clear norms and expectations for workers so they're not pressured to answer emails late at night. "We know what stress does to workers. We need to learn the soft skills," he added. When asked if he refrains from sending emails on the weekend, Nadella said, "I'm learning every day."

270.title: IT firm Kissflow gifts BMWs to 5 senior employees to honour their loyalty
270.article_body: Chennai-based IT firm Kissflow has gifted BMW cars worth over ₹1 crore each to five of its senior employees to honour their loyalty and commitment to the company. Kissflow CEO Suresh Sambandam said these employees have been with him right from the company's inception. Some of them hail from humble background and underwent various challenges before joining Kissflow, Sambandam added.

271.title: Hats off to determination: Jay on India's win vs Netherlands in Pro League
271.article_body: BCCI Secretary Jay Shah took to Twitter to congratulate India after they defeated reigning world and Olympic champions Netherlands 2-1 in the first match of their double leg tie at FIH Women's Pro Hockey League on Friday. "Hats off to the determination of team India to come out on top," he wrote. Navneet Kaur was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

272.title: Tourists visiting J&K due to CRPF's hard work, says Home Secy
272.article_body: Union Home Secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla on Saturday said it's due to the hard work of CRPF that many tourists are visiting J&K and that there's a sense of security in the Union Territory. Bhalla also praised security forces for neutralising "many hardcore terrorists" in J&K over the past year. A huge quantity of arms were also seized, he added.

273.title: SRH register biggest win by wickets in IPL 2022, CSK lose 4th match in a row
273.article_body: SRH registered their first win in IPL 2022 by defeating CSK by eight wickets on Saturday. It is the biggest win by wickets in the tournament so far. CSK have now lost four matches in a row. SRH opener Abhishek Sharma top-scored in the match with 75(50) as SRH chased down the 155-run target in 17.4 overs.

274.title: RCB to bowl first against winless MI in their IPL 2022 clash, Glenn Maxwell returns
274.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis won the toss and elected to bowl first against winless MI in their IPL 2022 clash. RCB have made one change to their playing XI, with Glenn Maxwell replacing Sherfane Rutherford. MI have made two changes to their playing XI, with Jaydev Unadkat replacing Tymal Mills and Ramandeep Singh replacing Daniel Sams.

275.title: What is a US green card that Rishi Sunak admitted he held as UK Finance Minister?
275.article_body: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak admitted that he held a US green card for over 18 months after becoming a UK government minister. Officially known as the Permanent Resident Card, a green card grants foreign nationals the right to live and work permanently in the United States. A green card holder is considered a resident of US for tax purposes.

276.title: 132 tortured bodies found in town freed from Russian forces: Ukraine
276.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry has accused Russian forces of leaving behind "tormented bodies" in the town of Makariv in the Kyiv region. It said that as Ukrainian rescuers are advancing in areas liberated by Russian forces, new "war crimes are [being] uncovered". "The town of Makariv is half-ruined. 132 tormented bodies of tortured, murdered citizens have already been found," it said.

277.title: MSRTC worker found dead near bus depot in Mumbai
277.article_body: A 43-year-old bus conductor of Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC), identified as Mahesh Lal, was found dead near the Parel Bus Depot in Mumbai. He had come to Mumbai from Kolhapur a few days ago to participate in the agitation outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's house. Police don't suspect foul play but have registered a case of accidental death.

278.title: Mock drills conducted in Delhi to counter terrorist attacks
278.article_body: The Delhi Police informed on Saturday that security agencies conducted mock drills in the national capital to counter terrorist attacks. Police said that the mega counter-terror mock drill was named 'Exercise All Out' and was executed at multiple locations. The police stated that there will be simulated terror attacks at various markets, institutions and offices across Delhi.

279.title: Sri Lanka's Opp'n threats no-trust vote against govt amid crisis
279.article_body: Sri Lanka's main opposition party on Friday said that it would move a no-confidence motion against the government if it does not take measures to address the severe economic crisis in the country. "We have called a meeting with all opposition leaders and will take a final decision on it soon," Sajith Premadasa, chief of Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), said.

280.title: Had I not conceded runs, wouldn't have got chance to hit sixes: GT's Tewatia
280.article_body: Following GT's six-wicket win against PBKS in IPL 2022, GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia said he wouldn't have got the chance to hit sixes in final two balls against PBKS if he hadn't conceded 24 runs in his single over. Tewatia scored a 3-ball 13*. GT are the only team who haven't lost a match in IPL 2022 so far.

281.title: Don't know which one of our cousins refused to give shoes to Babar Azam: Umar Akmal
281.article_body: Reacting to Pakistan captain Babar Azam claiming a cousin once refused to lend him shoes during his formative years in cricket, Umar Akmal, one of Babar's cousins, said, "I've no idea which cousin refused to give shoes to Babar." He added, "We've always offered support to relatives who wanted to play cricket. I've never turned down a request."

282.title: Leone shares her wedding pic, says 'opened wedding envelopes to pay for reception'
282.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone took to Instagram to share a picture from her wedding to celebrate her 11th marriage anniversary with Daniel Weber. In the caption, the actress wrote, "11 years married today! A time when we had no money, less than 50 guests...opening wedding envelopes to pay for our reception." "A reminder of how far we've come together," she added.

283.title: Pune woman kills 4-month-old kitten, says, 'it used to make noise'
283.article_body: Pune Police have booked a woman for allegedly killing a four-month-old kitten. According to the police, she hit the kitten's head with a blunt object after it entered her house. The woman reportedly told the police that the kitten used to come to her house often and made "noise". Police registered the case after the woman's neighbour filed the complaint.

284.title: Cong burns effigies of Amitabh, Akshay Kumar for not protesting fuel price hikes
284.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Congress burnt the effigies of Amitabh Bachchan and Akshay Kumar for allegedly being selective in their criticism of fuel price hikes and inflation. "In 2012, these actors used to tweet against fuel price hikes and inflation...At that time, an LPG cylinder used to cost ₹300-400, while petrol and diesel was around ₹60/litre," said Congress MLA PC Sharma.

285.title: Ricky Gervais, 50 Cent support Will Smith after 10 year Oscar ban
285.article_body: After Will Smith was banned from attending Academy events for the next 10 years, Ricky Gervais and 50 Cent among others have tweeted in support of him. "Hopefully, he'll only do 6 years with good behaviour," Ricky tweeted. 50 Cent wrote, "This is too harsh...He can't come back till he 63 years old. And the lawsuit ain't even hit yet."

286.title: TMC leader says, 'We can blow up area in 10 mins'; Malviya shares video
286.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya on Saturday shared a video wherein a TMC leader purportedly said, "Don't worry we have so much stock of bombs and guns that we can blow up the whole area in 10 minutes." He claimed the comments were made by TMC's Deputy Pradhan Sakir Ahmad. "West Bengal under Mamata Banerjee is waiting to explode," Malviya wrote.

287.title: AAP lost deposits in UP, it'll lose in Himachal also: Anurag Thakur
287.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Anurag Thakur on Saturday said that the BJP will retain power in Himachal Pradesh by winning the upcoming state Assembly elections. Further speaking about Aam Aadmi Party, Thakur said, "AAP has lost deposits in Uttar Pradesh and it will lose in Himachal Pradesh also." Notably, AAP Himachal Pradesh president Anup Kesari joined BJP on Friday.

288.title: Preparing for motherhood can be beautiful but messy: Kajal Aggarwal
288.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal on Saturday took to Instagram to share a picture from her maternity photoshoot, writing, "Preparing for motherhood can be beautiful but messy." The actress further wrote, "One moment you feel like you have everything under control, while the next moment, you're so drained." Kajal and her husband Gautam Kitchlu are expecting their first child together.

289.title: MI doesn't have a bowler who can support Bumrah well in IPL: Irfan
289.article_body: Irfan Pathan said MI know how to make a comeback after having lost three straight matches in IPL 2022. "In IPL 2015, they were in a similar situation...that team was a little different. This year, MI doesn't have a bowler who can support Jasprit Bumrah well. This is a major headache for...captain," he added. MI will face RCB today.

290.title: Don't expect Russia to be removed from UN Security Council: US
290.article_body: The White House on Friday said that it does not anticipate Russia to be suspended from the United Nations Security Council (UNSC). Notably, Russia is among the five permanent members of the UNSC and has veto power. Earlier, Russia was suspended from the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) in response to the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

291.title: A scene was cut off in a film, made my character look strange: Jacqueline
291.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez revealed that a filmmaker once cut her scene which made her character look very strange. Without naming the film, Jacqueline said her character had a quirk but the scene explaining it was chopped off. "A director friend came later and asked me about it and I said I have an explanation but it's too late," she added.

292.title: Imran not in his senses anymore, must be treated as psychopath: Nawaz Sharif's daughter
292.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif's daughter Maryam Nawaz has tweeted, "One person who is not in his senses anymore cannot be allowed to wreak havoc & bring the entire country down." She added, "He shouldn't be treated as PM or ex-PM, he must be treated as a psychopath who just to save his own skin is holding the entire country hostage."

293.title: I have a great bonding with SRK, he's a great listener: Sonu Sood
293.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood in an interview has said that he has a great bonding with actor Shah Rukh Khan, adding that the latter is a great listener. Sonu added that the two spent a lot of time together while shooting 2014 film 'Happy New Year'. "He really takes care of you as an elder brother, as a producer," Sonu said.

294.title: Russia expels 45 Polish diplomats in a tit-for-tat move
294.article_body: Russia has expelled 45 Polish embassy and consulate staff and declared them "persona non grata", the Russian Foreign Ministry said. This comes after Poland expelled the same number of Russian diplomats in March. Poland had said the Russian diplomats were suspected of working for Russian intelligence. Russia has given the diplomats time till April 13 to leave the country.

295.title: I don't know about the big day myself: Neetu on Ranbir-Alia's wedding
295.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor, when asked about her actor-son Ranbir Kapoor's wedding to actress Alia Bhatt, told ETimes, "I would like to celebrate it and say it out loud. But kids today are different." She added, "I don't know about the big day myself, as both are very private people." She also said, "Alia and Ranbir are made for each other."

296.title: We've become debt-free, repaid ₹2,925 crore loans: Ruchi Soya
296.article_body: Edible oil major Ruchi Soya has said that it has repaid ₹2,925 crore loans to banks and has become a debt-free company. The money was paid to a consortium of banks led by the State Bank of India. Baba Ramdev's Patanjali Ayurved-led Ruchi Soya has recently raised ₹4,300 crore through its follow-on public offer.

297.title: Suryakumar Yadav is the Shah Rukh Khan of MI: Harbhajan Singh
297.article_body: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh said MI batter Suryakumar Yadav is the Shah Rukh Khan of the franchise, referring to his 'Main Hoon Na' celebration in IPL 2020. "When he first came he was a bit fat but Suryakumar has lost a lot of weight in the past few years, and worked a lot [on] his game," added Harbhajan.

298.title: Will take strict action: Yogi govt after UP CMO's Twitter account hacked
298.article_body: After the Twitter account of UP CM's Office was briefly hacked, CM Yogi Adityanath-led state government said strict action will be taken against those responsible. The breach came to light when unidentified hackers published a post based on a tutorial called "How to turn your BAYC/MAYC animated on Twitter" on the CMO's account. They also changed the account's profile picture.

299.title: Russia has lost over 19,000 troops since invasion began: Ukraine
299.article_body: Ukrainian officials have claimed that Russia has lost over 19,000 troops since its invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. Officials said Russia has also lost 1,891 armoured personnel vehicles, 700 tanks and 135 helicopters. Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov on Thursday admitted that Russia had suffered "significant losses of troops" in what Russia calls a "special military operation" in Ukraine.

300.title: European Union to resume diplomatic presence in Kyiv
300.article_body: The European Union (EU) on Friday announced that it will resume its diplomatic presence in Kyiv. Notably, the EU's decision comes after a retreat by Russian forces from areas around the Ukrainian capital recently. The EU had moved its diplomatic mission to Poland after Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24 following months of tensions.

301.title: Govt websites hacked as Ukraine Prez addressed Parliament: Finland
301.article_body: Finland's government website and those of several ministries were hit by a cyberattack at the same time that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy was giving a video address to the Parliament on Friday, the government said. However, the situation has been normalised, Finland's Foreign Ministry said. Finland on Friday also reported a violation of Finnish airspace by a Russian state aircraft.

302.title: Will bring the best content for people: Ayushmann on upcoming projects
302.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, while talking about his upcoming projects, said he is confident that he will be bringing the best content for people to watch in 2022. "I have always looked to handpick projects that are out of the ordinary," Ayushmann said. The actor will be seen in three upcoming films, titled, 'Anek', 'Doctor G' and 'Action Hero'.

303.title: Germany may reintroduce COVID-19 measures in fall: Health Minister
303.article_body: Health Minister Karl Lauterbach on Friday said Germany may reintroduce certain COVID-19 measures such as mask-wearing in public in the fall when cases are expected to rise. German lawmakers on Thursday voted against imposing a COVID-19 vaccination mandate on people aged 60 and older. The mandate was supported by both German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Lauterbach.

304.title: Tom Holland buys Porsche Taycan Turbo S worth ₹2.13 cr, shares pic
304.article_body: Actor Tom Holland has purchased a Porsche Taycan Turbo S which is worth ₹2.13 crore. He took to Instagram to share a picture of the car, writing, "'Electric' Peter Kay. Thanks Porsche for helping me go electric." As per a report, Tom also owns an Audi RS7, Audi RS7 Sportback, Audi Q7, Audi R8 and Rolls Royce Cullinan Black Badge.

305.title: Four booked for gang-raping differently-abled woman in Gujarat
305.article_body: Police booked four men for allegedly gang-raping a woman in her late twenties, who is speech and hearing impaired, multiple times in Gujarat's Mehsana. The woman's son had informed his father about the incident, police said. When her husband confronted the accused, they threatened to kill the couple and their child and forced them to leave Mehsana, police added.

306.title: Sec 144 imposed after stones pelted at Shobha Yatra in Karnataka
306.article_body: After stones were allegedly pelted at the Rama Shobha Yatra procession on Friday night, prohibitory orders under CrPC Section 144 were imposed in Karnataka's Mulbagal.  According to the police, five people have been taken into custody till now. "As there was a disruption in the electricity supply, some miscreants may have taken advantage," Kolar SP D Devaraj said.

307.title: Central agencies looking into hoax bomb threat to B'luru schools: Min
307.article_body: After several schools in Bengaluru received hoax bomb threats via email, Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra today said that central agencies are looking into the matter. Jnanendra added that police are trying to find out who was behind the hoax threat. Meanwhile, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has claimed that this was a "conspiracy" to disturb the peace in the state.

308.title: UN seeks $80 million to prevent oil spill disaster off Yemen coast
308.article_body: The UN said it is seeking $80 million from donor nations to fund an emergency operation to remove a million barrels of crude oil from a tanker anchored off the coast of Yemen. An oil spill from the FSO Safer tanker "would unleash a massive ecological and humanitarian catastrophe", UN Resident and Humanitarian Coordinator for Yemen, David Gressly said.

309.title: BJP's personal agenda is to prioritise Hindi over other languages: HD Kumaraswamy
309.article_body: Janata Dal (Secular) leader HD Kumaraswamy has criticised Home Minister Amit Shah over his statement that Hindi should be an alternative to English. Kumaraswamy also accused the BJP-led Centre of imposing their "personal agendas" on citizens. "Central government...(is) actually trying to forcibly run their personal agendas. But they won't succeed. People will teach them a lesson," he said.

310.title: Used to sneak out silently when Happy New Year cast went to party: Sonu
310.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood in an interview has stated that people find it very difficult to take him to parties. The actor said that they were travelling while shooting 2014 film 'Happy New Year', Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone used to say, 'Let's go party'. "I used to sneak out silently. It's very difficult to party with me," Sonu added.

311.title: Odisha to establish hockey clubs in schools across all districts
311.article_body: Ahead of the FIH Hockey World Cup 2023 in Bhubaneswar, the Odisha government is all set to launch its 'Mo School Hockey Club' programme. The programme aims to establish a hockey club in at least one school of each district. There will be around 24-30 students in each wing of the club selected from Class 6 onwards, officials said.

312.title: Sebastian Vettel fined ₹4.12 lakh for riding scooter on Australian F1 track
312.article_body: Aston Martin driver Sebastian Vettel has been fined €5,000 (₹4.12 lakh) for riding a scooter on the Albert Park circuit following the conclusion of Free Practice 1 for the Australian Grand Prix on Friday. Vettel had borrowed the scooter from the marshals. The four-time champion was deemed to have broken Article 26.7 of the Sporting Regulations of Formula One.

313.title: Ram Charan to play double role in Shankar's 'RC15': Report
313.article_body: Actor Ram Charan will reportedly play a double role in Shankar Shanmugham's upcoming project tentatively titled 'RC15'. According to reports, the actor will be seen portraying the role of an officer and a student in the bilingual political drama. Written by Karthik Subbaraj, the film's music will be composed by S Thaman. It will also feature Kiara Advani.

314.title: Jamia ties up with digital online learning firm to impart skills to students
314.article_body: The Jamia Millia Islamia's placement cell has tied up with an online digital learning platform, IBM Skills Build-CSRBOX Foundation, to equip its students with essential technical skills. “The collaboration will facilitate the delivery of free digital learning to JMI students through the acquisition of essential skills like technical, professional and job readiness skills,” JMI said in a statement.

315.title: Chip undersupply to last until 2024: Volkswagen CFO
315.article_body: Volkswagen Chief Financial Officer Arno Antlitz has said that the supply of semiconductors is unlikely to completely meet the demands again until 2024. "The structural undersupply will likely only resolve itself in 2024," Antlitz said. He added that some issues might begin to ease towards 2022-end, with production returning to 2019 levels next year.

316.title: Nothing to worry: K'taka CM after Pai seeks PM's help over B'luru roads
316.article_body: Reacting to Information Technology industry veteran TV Mohandas Pai's remarks on Bengaluru's roads, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said there is no such reason to worry. Bommai also assured that there will be large-scale road repair works in the city in the coming days. Notably, Pai had tweeted, "[Bengaluru's] roads are bad and traffic sucks...[PM Narendra Modi, please intervene and help]."

317.title: NASA to resume crucial Artemis 1 Moon mission's 'wet dress rehearsal'
317.article_body: NASA will be resuming its 'wet dress rehearsal' for Artemis 1 Moon mission today. It began the rehearsal, a practice run of the most important prelaunch activities, last Friday. However, the attempt was suspended after a valve issue surfaced during tanking. The rehearsal includes a full countdown, loading the rocket's tanks with supercold propellant and draining the rocket tanks.

318.title: 'Mud volcano' erupts at a temple in Taiwan; video goes viral
318.article_body: A video of a 'mud volcano' that erupted at a temple in the Pingtung County of southern Taiwan has gone viral on social media platforms. The video showed the eruption spewed large amounts of mud and water above ground that flowed into surrounding roads and fields. The bursts reached as high as a one-storey building.

319.title: WMA writes to PM Modi, seeks solution against violence on doctors
319.article_body: The World Medical Association has written to PM Narendra Modi asking him to address violence against doctors in India. "Countering non-negligent treatment errors with prosecution...is not only unjust but will also have grave consequences," the letter read. "We observe an increasing rate of violence against [doctors]...This is a serious situation," said Dr Otmar Kloiber, WMA Secretary-General.

320.title: Plenty of unused COVID vaccine doses, won't buy fresh stock: Pune hospitals
320.article_body: Private hospitals in Pune have reportedly claimed that they have plenty of unused COVID-19 vaccine doses and are reluctant to order fresh stock. "We have 5,000-6,000 doses...and hardly 10 people are coming each day," Ruby Hall Clinic's CEO Bomi Bhote said. "We will be ordering after we've exhausted our pending stock of 3,000 doses," an official at Jehangir Hospital said.

321.title: I was asked to send pictures without clothes: Ankit Siwach on casting couch
321.article_body: TV actor Ankit Siwach, who began his modelling career in Delhi 12 years ago, recently spoke about facing the casting couch. The actor admitted that coming from Meerut to Delhi was a "culture shock" for him, adding, "I was asked to send pictures without clothes." He also said, "I was asked to come to parties that weren't related to work."

322.title: Country didn't only love me, but it also hit me with shoes: Rahul
322.article_body: Former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi on Saturday commented that India not only gave him love but also hit him with shoes. "I thought why is this happening? And got the answer that the country wants to teach me...The country is telling me that you should learn, understand," he said. He made the comments at the launch of a book.

323.title: Many girls would relate to my character in 'Lost': Pia Bajpiee
323.article_body: Actress Pia Bajpiee while talking about her next film 'Lost' said many girls would relate to her character. "It touched a chord with me...She is powerful, ambitious and vulnerable at the same time," Pia added. She further said that working with director Aniruddha Roy Chowdhury was like being in an institute as she learned a lot from him.

324.title: J&K ex-minister Babu Singh, absconding in Hawala case, arrested
324.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir minister Jatinder Singh alias 'Babu Singh', the main accused in a Hawala racket case that was busted by the police last month, was arrested from Kathua on Saturday. According to Jammu SSP Chandan Kohli, Jatinder Singh is being brought to Jammu for interrogation in connection to the Hawala money which was meant for subversive activities.

325.title: They weren't leaked from school or anywhere: Abhishek on pics of daughter shared online
325.article_body: On being asked how safe he feels when his daughter Aaradhya's pictures circulate on the internet with some even leaked from school, Abhishek Bachchan said, "No, they were not leaked from the school or anywhere." He added, "You'll shoot her whenever she steps out of the house. It is what it is. There is no point analysing it."

326.title: Rajkummar Rao wraps up shooting for Netflix's 'Guns & Gulaabs'
326.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao has completed shooting for his upcoming Netflix project titled 'Guns & Gulaabs'. "This journey wouldn't have been the same without you guys," Rajkummar wrote on Instagram while posting a picture with directors Raj Nidimoru and Krishna DK. Produced by D2R Films, 'Guns & Gulaabs' will be Rajkummar Rao's first series with Netflix.

327.title: Teammate of Kohli for a long time, first time he's so relaxed: Karthik
327.article_body: RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said he has been a teammate of Virat Kohli for a long time, but this is the first time Kohli is so relaxed. "There is so much time on his hands, I'm able to have long conversations," added Karthik. "I am genuinely enjoying it," stated Karthik. RCB have won two out of three IPL 2022 matches.

328.title: Delhi likely to get respite from rising temp in next 2 days: IMD
328.article_body: IMD official RK Jenamani on Saturday said that Delhi is likely to get some respite from rising temperatures in the coming two days. According to IMD, the national capital on Friday recorded a maximum temperature of 41.6°C, the highest so far this year. The maximum temperature at most places in Delhi on Friday settled at least seven degrees above normal.

329.title: Supply of mangoes to Pune to increase after April 20: Report
329.article_body: The supply of mangoes to Pune city is expected to improve after April 20, a Hindustan Times report said citing a trader. Due to a decline in supply this year, the prices of Ratnagiri and Devgad Alphonso mangoes range from ₹1,200 to ₹2,500 a dozen. The prices of other varieties of mango range from ₹600 to ₹1,000 a dozen.

330.title: 3 feared drowned as boat carrying 11 capsizes in river Ganga in Bihar
330.article_body: Three persons are feared drowned after a boat capsized in river Ganga near Brahmchari ghat in Bihar's Patna on Saturday. According to local residents, the small country boat carrying 11 people capsized due to high waves and strong currents. Prima facie, it appears that the boat was unable to sustain the weight of its occupants, an SDRF official said.

331.title: 13 arrested for raising anti-national slogans in Srinagar mosque
331.article_body: A total of 13 people have been arrested by Srinagar Police in the case related to anti-national and provocative sloganeering in and around Jamia Masjid, police said on Saturday. A video that surfaced on social media purportedly showed men raising Azadi slogans in the mosque. This was the first congregational prayer held in the mosque in the month of Ramzan.

332.title: Baffled by SRH's decisions, Williamson should bat at no. 3: Harbhajan
332.article_body: Harbhajan Singh said he is baffled by SRH's decision making with captain Kane Williamson opening for the franchise in IPL 2022, rather than batting at number three position. "Williamson's best numbers have come in IPL as well as for New Zealand when he has batted at number three," added Harbhajan. SRH are yet to record a win in IPL 2022.

333.title: Illegal weapons supplier held with 4 pistols in Gurugram
333.article_body: Police arrested an illegal weapon supplier and seized four pistols from him near Gurugram's Sohna. Police said they tried to stop a car coming from Sohna but the driver did not pay heed. "We somehow stopped the car and found two men inside. One of them fled as soon as the car was stopped, the other was nabbed," police said.

334.title: Avoid travelling to Shanghai due to arbitrary COVID curbs: US to citizens
334.article_body: The US has asked citizens to reconsider travel to China and avoid visiting COVID-19 hotspots, including Shanghai, due to "arbitrary enforcement" of virus restrictions amid the country's worst outbreak. The COVID-19 curbs include "the risk of parents and children being separated", the US warned. The US also authorised the "voluntary departure" of non-essential staff from its consulate in Shanghai.

335.title: Dissolve Petroleum Ministry with immediate effect: Akhilesh Yadav
335.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticised the Centre over hike in fuel price and said that Central government is "robbing the people". "If no government regulations...can control this reckless hike in fuel prices, and if everything is up to the market then what is the use of Petroleum Ministry? These ministries should be shut down with immediate effect," he tweeted.

336.title: I know Rashid Khan will get me out of the worst situations: Hardik
336.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya said he knows spinner Rashid Khan will help the team escape in the worst situations, adding that Rashid is his trump card. "I want batters to attack Rashid," stated Hardik. "He is an aggressive spinner which I don't see a lot," said Hardik. GT have recorded three wins in as many IPL 2022 matches.

337.title: India's 1st indigenous Polycentric Prosthetic Knee made: IIT M
337.article_body: IIT Madras researchers launched India's "first" indigenously made Polycentric Prosthetic Knee, 'Kadam'. It'll help above-knee amputees to walk with a comfortable gait. It's designed with high strength stainless steel and aluminium alloy along with hard chrome plated EN8 pins and high fatigue life polymer bushings. The Society for Biomedical Technology and Mobility India supported the development.

338.title: We sent message to Mayawati for alliance, offered CM post: Rahul
338.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday claimed that amid the Uttar Pradesh elections, his party had sent a message to BSP chief Mayawati for an alliance and offered her the CM post, but she didn't respond. He also claimed that she didn't fight for "Dalit voices" because of CBI, ED and Pegasus. Gandhi was speaking at a book launch event.

339.title: Hope to have same equation with Alia I had with my mother-in-law: Neetu
339.article_body: Veteran actress Neetu Kapoor has stated that her relationship with her mother-in-law Krishna Raj Kapoor was outstanding. She added that Krishna loved her more than her son late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor. "I hope to have the same equation with Alia because she is outstanding and amazing," Neetu said. Alia and Ranbir are reported to get married on April 14.

340.title: 'Liger' director Puri Jagannadh to star in Chiranjeevi's 'Godfather'
340.article_body: 'Liger' director Puri Jagannadh has signed on to act in Chiranjeevi-starrer 'Godfather'. Chiranjeevi made the announcement on Twitter, adding that Jagannadh will be seen in a special role in the film. Helmed by Mohan Raja, 'Godfather' is the Telugu remake of Malayalam film 'Lucifer'. The film also stars Nayanthara and Satyadev Kancharana in key roles.

341.title: Russian air strikes to increase in Ukraine's south, east: UK
341.article_body: Russian air activity is expected to increase in Ukraine's south and east, the UK's Defence Ministry said. The ministry added that "Russia is continuing to hit Ukrainian non-combatants, such as those killed in yesterday's rocket strike on Kramatorsk railway station in eastern Ukraine". At least 52 people were reportedly killed and several others were injured in Friday's railway station attack.

342.title: Insomnia could increase the risk of type 2 diabetes: Study
342.article_body: According to a study, people with insomnia are at an increased risk of developing type 2 diabetes. Insomnia symptoms cause higher Hemoglobin A1C levels, indicating it plays a causal role in the condition. "Eating healthy balanced diet, being active, along with getting enough sleep, are all essential for...those at risk of, or living with, type 2 diabetes," a researcher said.

343.title: Mizoram has started issuing identity cards to Myanmar refugees: Official
343.article_body: Myanmar government has started issuing identity cards to refugees from Myanmar, a Home Department official said. "The cards will facilitate speedy...easier identification of refugees...prevent them from enrolling in the state's voters' list," the official added. A total of 29,532 Myanmarese refugees have sought shelter in Mizoram since the military takeover in February 2021, as per official data.

344.title: Covishield and Covaxin vaccine prices for private hospitals cut to ₹225 per dose
344.article_body: Serum Institute of India revised the price of Covishield vaccine for private hospitals from ₹600 to ₹225 per dose. Bharat Biotech also revised the price of Covaxin vaccine from ₹1,200 to ₹225 per dose for private hospitals. Earlier today, the Centre said, "Private COVID-19 vaccination centres can charge only up to a maximum of ₹150 as service charge for vaccination."

345.title: Can't be selfish to discuss Liverpool contract right now: Mo Salah
345.article_body: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has said that he can't be "selfish" to discuss his contract while the club is focused on winning trophies. "I can't be selfish and talk about my (contract)," Salah said. "We (Liverpool) are in the most important period...so I have to just talk about (Liverpool)," he added. Notably, Salah's contract expires in June 2023.

346.title: IIIT-Lucknow student gets ₹1.2 cr package with Amazon job, institute's highest-ever
346.article_body: A final year B.Tech student at Indian Institute of Information and Technology, Lucknow, has bagged the institute's highest-ever annual salary package of ₹1.2 crore. Abhijeet Dwivedi has been hired as a software development engineer for Amazon in Dublin, Ireland, TOI reported. "I saw several videos to prepare myself for the interview. Soft skills matter a lot," Dwivedi said.

347.title: Which players have hit a six off the last ball of the 20th over to win an IPL match?
347.article_body: GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia became the 10th cricketer to slam a six off last delivery to win an IPL match. Rohit Sharma, Ambati Rayudu, Saurabh Tiwary, Dwayne Bravo, MS Dhoni, Mitchell Santner, Nicholas Pooran, Ravindra Jadeja and Srikar Bharat are the other nine batters to do so. Rohit did it thrice, against KKR (2009), PWI (2011) and Deccan Chargers (2012).

348.title: Go to India if you like it so much: Ex-Pak PM Nawaz Sharif's daughter to Imran Khan
348.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif's daughter Maryam Sharif has criticised Imran Khan for praising India. She tweeted, "Someone should tell a person who has gone mad after seeing this power gone that he has been expelled by his own party and no one else." She added, "If you like India so much then shift there and leave the life of Pakistan."

349.title: Veteran Telugu actor M Balayya passes away aged 94
349.article_body: Veteran Telugu actor M Balayya passed away at the age of 94 on Saturday morning. Balayya had made his debut as an actor with 'Ettuku Pai Ettu' in the year 1958 and acted in nearly 300 films. He also received the Gold Nandi Award from Andhra Pradesh government for his play 'Nalupu Telupu' which was later made into 'Chelleli Kapuram'.

350.title: Rahman shares poster on Tamil after Shah said Hindi should replace English
350.article_body: Composer AR Rahman has shared a poster titled 'Tamizhanangu' highlighting the significance of Tamil. The poster also has poet Bharathidasan's line 'Inba Thamizh Engal Urimai Sempayirukku Vaer' (Delightful Tamil is the root of the staple crop of our rights). This comes after Home Minister Amit Shah stated that Hindi should be an alternative to English for people from different states.

351.title: 69 police trainees hospitalised after having dinner at Maha training centre
