351.article_body: As many as 69 police trainees from the Police Training Centre in Maharashtra's Dhule were hospitalised after they complained of stomach ache and vomiting. According to Dhule SP Pravinkumar Patil, it seems the trainees fell ill after having dinner. The SP added that the condition of the trainees is stable now and 29 of them have been kept under observation.

352.title: Sindhu, Srikanth lose in the semis at 2022 Korea Open
352.article_body: Third seed PV Sindhu lost in women's singles semi-final at 2022 Korea Open on Saturday. She was defeated by second seed An Seyoung of South Korea 21-14, 21-17 in 48 minutes. In men's singles semi-final, Indian shuttler Kidambi Srikanth, seeded fifth, lost to third seeded Jonatan Christie 19-21, 16-21 in 49 minutes. With this, India's campaign ended in the tournament.

353.title: 40-year-old neighbour kidnaps, rapes 6-year-old girl in Thane
353.article_body: A 40-year-old man allegedly abducted a six-year-old girl from his neighbour and raped her inside his home in Thane, a police official said. The accused, who is identified as Anwar Shaikh, fled from the spot after being confronted by neighbours, Inspector (Crime) Sunil Shinde said. Police have launched an investigation into the matter and are trying to nab the accused.

354.title: Dead shark in UK found to have meningitis in a 'world's first' case
354.article_body: A rare Greenland dead shark found washed up on a beach in the UK's Cornwall had meningitis, post mortem concluded, which scientists are calling the "world's first" such case. The female shark, thought to be around 100 years old, was found by walkers last month. The shark's brain was "discoloured and congested", while the fluid around the brain was cloudy.

355.title: Was born in centre of power but I don't have interest in it: Rahul
355.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that he was born in the "centre of power", but he "honestly" doesn't have an interest in it. He claimed that there're politicians who think about attaining power throughout the day, then sleep and repeat the cycle, while he tries to understand the country instead. Gandhi was speaking at a book launch event.

356.title: AAP was about to remove Anup Kesari on allegation of dirty acts against women: Sisodia
356.article_body: A day after AAP chief in Himachal Pradesh Anup Kesari joined BJP, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that the party was about to remove him on the allegation of dirty acts against women. "The place of such people is in BJP only," Sisodia added. "The top leadership of the BJP is scared of AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal," Sisodia tweeted.

357.title: Police arrest 3 for stealing LPG gas from cylinders in Pune
357.article_body: Pune Police have recently arrested three people involved in pilfering LPG gas from cylinders and illegally selling it. A tempo, 31 full cylinders and six empty cylinders were seized from their possession. "The accused were found transferring...gas from cylinders and filling them into empty ones. We raided the premises and caught the accused red-handed," a senior police official said.

358.title: Austrian Chancellor Nehammer to visit Ukraine, meet Prez Zelenskyy
358.article_body: Austrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer's office on Friday said he has set off on a one-day visit to Ukraine where he will meet with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "It is important that within the framework of our neutrality we stand by Ukraine on a humanitarian level as well as politically," Nehammer said. Although neutral, Austria has provided Ukraine with humanitarian aid.

359.title: EU chief offers Ukraine fast-track membership to European Union
359.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Friday offered Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy paperwork that will allow Ukraine to become a member of the European Union. "It will not be, as usual, a matter of years, but rather a matter of weeks," she said. Her visit to Ukraine is the first by top EU officials since Russia's invasion began.

360.title: Test blast at Noida's Supertech towers on Sunday, locals told to stay indoors
360.article_body: Ahead of the test explosion at Supertech twin towers in Noida Sector 93A on Sunday, an advisory was issued asking residents of nearby societies to remain indoors from 2:15-2.45 pm. Traffic will remain suspended on the stretch for 30 minutes. "It'll be a...low-intensity blast to check the amount of explosives required for the main explosion," Emerald Society RWA president said.

361.title: Bottom-placed SRH to bowl first against winless CSK, playing XIs announced
361.article_body: SRH won the toss and elected to bowl first against CSK in their IPL 2022 clash. CSK have made one change to their playing XI, with Maheesh Theekshana replacing Dwaine Pretorius. SRH have included Shashank Singh and Marco Jansen in their playing XI. Both the teams are winless in the tournament, with SRH being last on the points table.

362.title: German Prez calls for probe into war crimes against Putin, Lavrov
362.article_body: German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier on Friday called for a war crimes tribunal against Russian President Vladimir Putin and Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov. "Anyone who has responsibility for these crimes will have to explain themselves," Steinmeier said. "That includes soldiers. That includes military commanders. And of course also those that have the political responsibility," he added.

363.title: Employee steals Delhi employer’s bike over unpaid dues, demands ₹20,000
363.article_body: A 25-year-old man in Delhi's Nihal Vihar stole his employer's motorcycle and demanded ₹20,000 in exchange for returning it, police said. During interrogation, the accused, identified as Anoop Singh, disclosed that his employer refused to pay his pending dues, so he stole his bike to teach him a lesson and get his money back. He has been arrested, police said.

364.title: Goa CM Pramod Sawant expands his Cabinet by inducting 3 more ministers
364.article_body: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Saturday expanded his Cabinet by inducting three more MLAs as ministers. BJP MLAs Nilkanth Halarnkar and Subhash Phaldesai and Maharashtrawadi Gomantak Party (MGP) MLA Sudin Madhav Dhavalikar took oath in the presence of CM Sawant. Goa Governor PS Sreedharan Pillai administered the oath of office to the three new ministers.

365.title: 1st all private crew to ISS carries US hospital mascot soft toy
365.article_body: The first all private crew to the space station, launched by SpaceX, carried a plush toy of 'Caramel', the mascot for the Montreal Children's Hospital Foundation, as its zero-g indicator. The crew selected Caramel as their indicator in part because of the mission's connection to the hospital. Caramel was earlier briefly mistaken for Disney's rabbit Thumper from Bambi.

366.title: Woman dragged on road while trying to resist snatching bid in Delhi
366.article_body: A 23-year-old woman was allegedly dragged on the road for a few metres while trying to stop three bike-borne men from snatching her handbag in Delhi's Mundka. One of the snatchers was caught by the public after the woman screamed for help, while the two others fled. Meanwhile, police have registered a case and are looking for the absconding suspects.

367.title: 110 arrested for protesting outside Sharad Pawar's Mumbai house
367.article_body: A total of 110 persons have been arrested in connection with the protest outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's Mumbai house on Friday. The employees of MSRTC protested, claiming he didn't do anything for their demand of merging the corporation with the state government. On Friday evening, 103 were arrested on charges of rioting, unlawful assembly, assault and criminal conspiracy.

368.title: Japan bans Russian coal imports, expels eight diplomats
368.article_body: Japan PM Fumio Kishida on Friday announced the expulsion of eight Russian diplomats and a ban on Russian coal imports in response to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. "Russia has repeatedly violated international humanitarian law by killing civilians and attacking nuclear power plants. These are unforgivable war crimes," Kishida added. Russia accounted for 11% of Japan's total coal imports in 2021.

369.title: Delhi HC dismisses plea moved by fugitive against extradition proceedings
369.article_body: Delhi HC dismissed a plea moved by a fugitive accused seeking quashing of extradition proceedings. The petitioner is an accused in a rape case lodged in London in 2017. "This court is of the considered view...petition is premature," HC ruled. Extradition proceedings were initiated without due compliance with the Extradition Treaty between India and the UK, the petitioner's counsel said.

370.title: UK FM Sunak's wife Akshata to pay UK taxes on global earnings amid criticism
370.article_body: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak's India-born wife Akshata Murthy said she'll pay UK taxes on her global earnings following a row over her non-domicile status. Noting that her tax arrangements are "entirely legal", Murthy said, "I do this because I want to...I do not wish my tax status to be a distraction for my husband or to affect my family."

371.title: My husband Rishi was a full-time job, thaka dete the: Neetu
371.article_body: Veteran actress Neetu Kapoor, speaking about the demise of her husband actor Rishi Kapoor, has said that she got back to work because she didn't know where her life would have gone. "My husband was a full-time job...Thaka dete the (He would tire me out)," she added. Neetu further said that even her children told her to get herself busy.

372.title: Pune man loses ₹17 lakh after being lured by 'Playboy' male escort job
372.article_body: Cyber fraudsters allegedly cheated a 27-year-old unemployed man of over ₹17 lakh on the pretext of giving him a job in a male escort service named 'Playboy', police said. The accused had promised the victim that he'll be paid ₹3,000 per hour and asked for 'license fees'. The victim reportedly paid ₹17 lakh using his deceased father's savings and FD.

373.title: Private centres can take up to ₹150 as service charge for COVID-19 booster dose: Govt
373.article_body: Union Health Secretary on Saturday said that the precaution dose will be of same vaccine which was used for administration of previous two doses and no fresh registrations would be required on CoWIN. Private vaccination centres can charge up to a maximum of ₹150 as service charge for vaccination over and above the cost of vaccine, the government added.

374.title: 3 teens die, 3 hospitalised after consuming poison in Bihar's Aurangabad
374.article_body: Three teenage girls died and three others were hospitalised after six friends consumed poison together in Bihar's Aurangabad on Friday. The girls had reportedly gone to the pond outside their village in the evening and consumed a poisonous substance in the field. They were rushed to a hospital when villagers spotted them. Police are investigating the reason behind the incident.

375.title: Stand up for refugees: Priyanka to world leaders in video amid Ukraine crisis
375.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra took to social media to make an appeal to the world leaders amid the Ukraine-Russia war. "World leaders, we need you to stand up for refugees around the world to ensure that they get the support they need now," the actress said. "We can't just stand by and watch. It's gone on too long," she added.

376.title: Same-sex couple in Maharashtra sign MoU for legal protection after harassment by family
376.article_body: A same-sex couple, comprising a 28-year-old woman and a 19-year-old woman, seeking validity for their relationship registered a notarised MoU in a Pune court to ensure protection from their families who are against their relationship. The family of the 19-year-old began to harass them and since February, they faced "serious threat to their lives", the couple's lawyer Vikas Shinde said.

377.title: Exercise can lower risk of getting bowel cancer: Research
377.article_body: According to research, exercising multiple times a week over an extended period of time can reduce the risk of developing bowel cancer. Cancer-fighting substances such as IL-6 are released into the bloodstream when a person exercises regularly, a researcher said. These substances interact with abnormal cells, repairing their DNA and reducing the growth of cancer, he added.

378.title: I accept and respect the decision: Will Smith on 10-year Oscars ban
378.article_body: Will Smith said, "I accept and respect the Academy's decision," after the actor was banned from attending the Oscars or other related events and programs for 10 years for slapping presenter Chris Rock. In a statement, the Academy had called Smith's behaviour "unacceptable and harmful". Smith had slapped Chris after he joked about his wife's Alopecia condition at the Oscars.

379.title: Lmaooo: Musk on Bezos-owned paper criticising his new role at Twitter
379.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk tweeted "Lmaooo" in response to The Washington Post op-ed titled, 'Elon Musk's vision of 'free speech' will be bad for Twitter'. It said, "Musk's appointment to Twitter's board shows that we need regulation of social-media platforms to prevent rich people from controlling our channels of communication." World's second-richest man Jeff Bezos owns The Washington Post.

380.title: India's forex reserves fall by $11.173 billion in steepest weekly fall ever
380.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves slid by $11.173 billion to $606.475 billion in the week ended April 1, marking the steepest weekly fall ever, data from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) showed. This is the fourth consecutive weekly fall in the country's forex reserves. The latest weekly decline in reserves was due to a plunge in foreign currency assets (FCAs).

381.title: 12-year-old girl raped in public toilet near Pune railway station
381.article_body: A 12-year-old girl was allegedly raped in a public toilet near Pune railway station. The accused has not been identified yet, police said. The girl's mother, who is a resident of an area near the toilet, said the incident took place when her daughter went to relieve herself at the toilet. Police have launched a search to arrest the accused.

382.title: Tesla may have to mine, refine lithium as its price is insane: Musk
382.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk reacted to lithium's rising price over the years, saying, "Price of lithium has gone to insane levels! Tesla might actually have to get into the mining and refining directly at scale, unless costs improve." "There is no shortage of the element itself, as lithium is almost everywhere...but pace of extraction/refinement is slow," Musk added

383.title: Govt reserves 25% defence procurement budget for domestic private industry
383.article_body: Ministry of Defence reserved ₹21,149 crore or 25% of the domestic capital acquisition budget for the domestic private industry to encourage the private sector to take part in defence production. This comes two months after India earmarked 68% of the capital procurement budget for the entire domestic industry. India allocated ₹5.25 lakh crore for military spending in this year's budget.

384.title: Wanted to hit sixes, nothing else in mind: Tewatia on 3-ball 13* vs PBKS
384.article_body: Reacting to his 3-ball 13* which helped GT chase down 19 runs in the final over against PBKS, all-rounder Rahul Tewatia said he just wanted to hit sixes with nothing else in his mind. "The last [shot] was off the middle of the bat...I knew it was [a] six," added Tewatia. GT are unbeaten in IPL 2022 so far.

385.title: I tried to pull De Villiers and Kohli away at times, jokes Maxwell
385.article_body: Recalling IPL 2021, RCB batter Glenn Maxwell joked that he tried to pull AB de Villiers and Virat Kohli away at times, terming them as "two peas in a pod". "When De Villiers announced his retirement, it was a...shock," said Maxwell. "It was awesome to have a few drinks with De Villiers and discuss life," added Maxwell.

386.title: Museum on history of cartoon art set up at Savitribai Phule Pune University
386.article_body: A first-of-its-kind museum on cartoon art has been set up at Savitribai Phule Pune University (SSPU). Visitors can reportedly view the works of famous Indian cartoonists as well as a variety of cartoon art from across India, spread over 200 years. The biggest section is devoted to cartoons and illustrations done during the establishment of the 'British Raj', reports stated.

387.title: He reminds me of Kohli at his prime: Shastri on Gill's 59-ball 96
387.article_body: Talking about GT opener Shubman Gill's 96 off 59 balls at a strike rate of 162.71 in the win against PBKS, Ravi Shastri said Gill reminds him of Virat Kohli at his prime. "Gill batted beautifully again, really really beautifully," added Shastri. "People would love to pay money to watch him bat when in full flow," stated Shastri.

388.title: Gurugram man stabs mother for not helping him reconcile with his wife
388.article_body: The Gurugram police arrested a 44-year-old man for allegedly stabbing his 66-year-old mother to death. The accused Manish revealed that his wife had left home due to some personal dispute and he was trying hard to reconcile with her but his mother was not very keen on it and was pressuring him not to bring her back, the police said.

389.title: Kejriwal ignored and insulted us: Anup Kesari after joining BJP
389.article_body: Former Himachal Pradesh AAP chief Anup Kesari criticised Arvind Kejriwal and accused him of "being ignorant" against AAP Himachal unit leaders during a roadshow in Mandi constituency. "Arvind Kejriwal overlooked the state party workers when he came for a rally. In the hill state, AAP workers considered this ignorance as an insult and quit the party for self-respect," Kesari said.

390.title: Navi Mumbai student arrested for stocking, circulating child porn via Insta
390.article_body: A 23-year-old student from Navi Mumbai has been arrested for allegedly circulating and stocking child pornography via messages on Instagram, police said. The accused had allegedly created an account on Instagram under a fake identity for this purpose. Police have seized the accused's mobile phone, which contains several such videos, along with financial transactions related to the content.

391.title: Kidnapped Pune land dealer rescued from Nepal border in UP; 2 held
391.article_body: Two people were arrested and four others are absconding after a land dealer, who was kidnapped from Pune, was rescued from near India-Nepal border in Uttar Pradesh. The accused had kidnapped the dealer on March 24 after calling him under the pretext of paying for the land they'd purchased, police said. The accused had demanded ₹10 lakh ransom, police added.

392.title: AT&T's WarnerMedia, Discovery merge, become Warner Bros Discovery
392.article_body: AT&T WarnerMedia unit and Discovery have completed their merger and the combined entity will be called Warner Bros Discovery. The new firm's portfolio includes Discovery Channel, Warner Bros Entertainment, CNN, HBO, Cartoon Network, streaming services Discovery+ and HBO Max and franchises like 'Batman' and 'Harry Potter'. It'll start trading on Monday under the ticker symbol 'WBD'.

393.title: Delivery of blood samples by drones begins in Gurugram
393.article_body: A private diagnostics company began a pilot project in Gurugram to collect blood samples from hospitals using drones and deliver them to labs. The aim of using drones is to cut down on turnaround time and provide faster test reports. A four-day trial will take place in and around Gurugram to test the efficacy of the system, the officials said.

394.title: Saudi Arabia to allow 1 million Muslim pilgrims for Haj 2022
394.article_body: Saudi Arabia has said it'll allow one million people, from both inside and outside the kingdom, to attend the Haj pilgrimage this year, state media reported. Only people aged under 65 who have been vaccinated against COVID-19 will be allowed to take part, the Ministry of Haj said. Last year, the kingdom limited the annual Haj to 60,000 domestic participants.

395.title: Malaika Arora pens post on her accident, says 'Feels like a scene from a film'
395.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora took to Instagram to pen a post on her car accident which occurred last week. "Last few days and events that unfolded have been quite unbelievable. Thinking about it in retrospect feels like a scene from a film and not something that actually happened," she wrote. "I'm a fighter...I’ll be back before you know it!" she added.

396.title: How much did Congress earn and spend in FY21 as compared to FY20?
396.article_body: The income of Indian National Congress declined by over 58% in financial year 2020-21, down from ₹682.2 crore in the previous fiscal to ₹285.7 crore, according to its audit report submitted to Election Commission. The party's expenditure dipped from ₹998.15 crore in the previous fiscal year to ₹209 crore in FY 2021. Congress' income in FY19 stood at ₹918 crore.

397.title: Odisha govt engineer held over disproportionate assets worth over ₹5 cr
397.article_body: An assistant engineer, working in the Odisha Water Resources Department, was arrested for possessing disproportionate assets worth over ₹5 crore in Bhubaneswar, an officer said. The vigilance officials raided the engineer's house and seized over ₹2 crore in cash, the highest cash seizure in the history of Odisha Vigilance and 20 gold biscuits weighing around 580 grams, among other valuables.

398.title: B'luru police reunites boy who got lost with his parents in 6 hrs
398.article_body: Bengaluru's Yashavanthapura traffic police station tweeted that it helped reunite a boy who got lost in a crowd after locating his parents within six hours. The traffic police said that one of their personnel had spotted the boy who was in a "state of fear", gave him food and reassured him. The traffic police also shared pictures of the incident.

399.title: Yes, Alia-Ranbir's wedding is happening and I've been invited: Alia's half-brother
399.article_body: Alia Bhatt's half-brother Rahul Bhatt in an interview with Bombay Times confirmed that the actress is getting married to actor Ranbir Kapoor. "Yes, the wedding is happening and I have been invited. I will be there for the ceremonies," he said. On welcoming Ranbir to the family, he said, "I haven't met Ranbir in the capacity of Alia's boyfriend."

400.title: 3 given 10 years imprisonment for attempting to rape woman in Guj
400.article_body: Three persons were sentenced to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment by a Rajkot court in Gujarat for attempting to gang-rape a woman. Two of the three convicts admitted they tried to rape the woman who had gone to fetch water from a village tap in May 2020. The third one, on the other hand, was recording the video, they confessed.
